sense and humour; but I cannot tell you much about him personally,
because']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: I know, because you talked to him in a dark room.
subQuotationList: ['I know,', 'because you talked to him in a dark room.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Burgundy is a jolly thing,
subQuotationList: ['Burgundy is a jolly thing,']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
You don't look as if it were, you drink it as if it were
medicine.
subQuotationList: ["You don't look as if it were,", 'you drink it as if it were\nmedicine.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
You must excuse my manner, my position
is rather a curious one. Inside I am really bursting with boyish
merriment; but I acted the paralytic Professor so well, that now I
can't leave off. So that when I am among friends, and have no need at
all to disguise myself, I still can't help speaking slow and wrinkling
my forehead just as if it were my forehead. I can be quite happy, you
understand, but only in a paralytic sort of way. The most buoyant
exclamations leap up in my heart, but they come out of my mouth quite
different. You should hear me say,  Buck up, old cock!' It would bring
tears to your eyes.
subQuotationList:
['You must excuse my manner,', "my position
is rather a curious one. Inside I am really bursting with boyish
merriment; but I acted the paralytic Professor so well, that now I
can't leave off. So that when I am among friends, and have no need at
all to disguise myself, I still can't help speaking slow and wrinkling
my forehead just as if it were my forehead. I can be quite happy, you
understand, but only in a paralytic sort of way. The most buoyant
exclamations leap up in my heart, but they come out of my mouth quite
different. You should hear me say,  Buck up, old cock!' It would bring
tears to your eyes."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
It does, but I cannot help thinking that apart from all
that you are really a bit worried.
subQuotationList: ['It does,', 'but I cannot help thinking that apart from all\nthat you are really a bit worried.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
You are a very clever fellow, it is a pleasure to work with
you. Yes, I have rather a heavy cloud in my head. There is a great
problem to face, Can you play the piano?
subQuotationList: ['You are a very clever fellow,', 'it is a pleasure to work with\nyou. Yes, I have rather a heavy cloud in my head. There is a great\nproblem to face,', 'Can you play the piano?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Yes, I'm supposed to have a good touch.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', "I'm supposed to have a good touch."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: I trust the great cloud is lifted.
subQuotationList: ['I trust the great cloud is lifted.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: It would have done just as well if you could work a typewriter.
subQuotationList: ['It would have done just as well if you could work a typewriter.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Thank you, you flatter me.
subQuotationList: ['Thank you,', 'you flatter me.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Listen to me, and remember whom we have to see
tomorrow. You and I are going tomorrow to attempt something which is
very much more dangerous than trying to steal the Crown Jewels out of
the Tower. We are trying to steal a secret from a very sharp, very
strong, and very wicked man. I believe there is no man, except the
President, of course, who is so seriously startling and formidable as
that little grinning fellow in goggles. He has not perhaps the
white-hot enthusiasm unto death, the mad martyrdom for anarchy, which
marks the Secretary. But then that very fanaticism in the Secretary has
a human pathos, and is almost a redeeming trait. But the little Doctor
has a brutal sanity that is more shocking than the Secretary's disease.
Don't you notice his detestable virility and vitality. He bounces like
an india-rubber ball. Depend on it, Sunday was not asleep (I wonder if
he ever sleeps?) when he locked up all the plans of this outrage in the
round, black head of Dr. Bull.
subQuotationList:
['Listen to me,', "and remember whom we have to see
tomorrow. You and I are going tomorrow to attempt something which is
very much more dangerous than trying to steal the Crown Jewels out of
the Tower. We are trying to steal a secret from a very sharp, very
strong, and very wicked man. I believe there is no man, except the
President, of course, who is so seriously startling and formidable as

he ever sleeps?) when he locked up all the plans of this outrage in the
round, black head of Dr. Bull."]
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionTextsList: [[], ['we', 'You', 'We', 'the\nPresident', 'the Secretary', 'the Secretary', 'the little Doctor', "the Secretary's", 'you', 'his', 'He', 'Sunday ', 'he', 'he', 'Dr. Bull']]
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['The Secretary'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull']]]

quoteText:
And you think, that this unique monster will be soothed
if I play the piano to him?
subQuotationList: ['And you think,', 'that this unique monster will be soothed\nif I play the piano to him?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Don't be an ass, I mentioned the piano because it
gives one quick and independent fingers. Syme, if we are to go through
this interview and come out sane or alive, we must have some code of
signals between us that this brute will not see. I have made a rough
alphabetical cypher corresponding to the five fingers like this, see, B A D, bad, a word
we may frequently require.
subQuotationList:
["Don't be an ass,", 'I mentioned the piano because it
gives one quick and independent fingers. Syme, if we are to go through
this interview and come out sane or alive, we must have some code of
signals between us that this brute will not see. I have made a rough
alphabetical cypher corresponding to the five fingers like this, see,', 'B A D, bad, a word
we may frequently require.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Bull']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
We must have several word-signs, words that we
are likely to want, fine shades of meaning. My favourite word is
 coeval'. What's yours?
subQuotationList: ['We must have several word-signs,', "words that we\nare likely to want, fine shades of meaning. My favourite word is\n coeval'. What's yours?"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Do stop playing the goat, You don't
know how serious this is.
subQuotationList: ['Do stop playing the goat,', "You don't\nknow how serious this is."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Lush' too, we must have
 lush' word applied to grass, don't you know?
subQuotationList: ["Lush' too,", "we must have\n lush' word applied to grass, don't you know?"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Do you imagine, that we are going to
talk to Dr. Bull about grass?
subQuotationList: ['Do you imagine,', 'that we are going to\ntalk to Dr. Bull about grass?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
There are several ways in which the subject could be approached, and the word introduced without appearing forced.
We might say,  Dr. Bull, as a revolutionist, you remember that a tyrant
once advised us to eat grass; and indeed many of us, looking on the
fresh lush grass of summer...'
subQuotationList:
['There are several ways in which the subject could be approached,', "and the word introduced without appearing forced.
We might say,  Dr. Bull, as a revolutionist, you remember that a tyrant
once advised us to eat grass; and indeed many of us, looking on the
fresh lush grass of summer...'"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Do you understand, that this is a tragedy?
subQuotationList: ['Do you understand,', 'that this is a tragedy?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Perfectly, always be comic in a tragedy. What the
deuce else can you do? I wish this language of yours had a wider scope.
I suppose we could not extend it from the fingers to the toes? That
would involve pulling off our boots and socks during the conversation,
which however unobtrusively performed
subQuotationList:
['Perfectly,', 'always be comic in a tragedy. What the
deuce else can you do? I wish this language of yours had a wider scope.
I suppose we could not extend it from the fingers to the toes? That
would involve pulling off our boots and socks during the conversation,
which however unobtrusively performed']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Syme, go to bed!
subQuotationList: ['Syme,', 'go to bed!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Well, I dreamt of that alphabet of yours. Did it take you long to
make it up?
subQuotationList: ['Well,', 'I dreamt of that alphabet of yours. Did it take you long to\nmake it up?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I say, did it take you long to invent all this? I'm considered good at
these things, and it was a good hour's grind. Did you learn it all on
the spot?
subQuotationList: ["I say, did it take you long to invent all this? I'm considered good at\nthese things, and it was a good hour's grind. Did you learn it all on\nthe spot?"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: How long did it take you?
subQuotationList: ['How long did it take you?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Confound you, can't you answer?
subQuotationList: ["Confound you, can't you answer?"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: I will only talk like this. We must get used to it.
subQuotationList: ['I will only talk like this. We must get used to it.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
referringExpression: Syme watched the twinkling movements of the talking hand and read

quoteText: All right. Let's get out to breakfast.
subQuotationList: ["All right. Let's get out to breakfast."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: I'm sorry to disturb you so early, comrade,
subQuotationList: ["I'm sorry to disturb you so early, comrade,"]
speaker: Professor De Worms
referringExpression: the Professor broke silence and began

quoteText:
You have no doubt made
all the arrangements for the Paris affair?
subQuotationList: ['You have no doubt made\nall the arrangements for the Paris affair?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
We have information which renders intolerable anything in
the nature of a moment's delay.
subQuotationList: ["We have information which renders intolerable anything in\nthe nature of a moment's delay."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Please do not think me excessively abrupt; but I advise you to alter
those plans, or if it is too late for that, to follow your agent with
all the support you can get for him. Comrade Syme and I have had an
experience which it would take more time to recount than we can afford,
if we are to act on it. I will, however, relate the occurrence in
detail, even at the risk of losing time, if you really feel that it is
essential to the understanding of the problem we have to discuss.
subQuotationList:
['Please do not think me excessively abrupt; but I advise you to alter
those plans, or if it is too late for that, to follow your agent with
all the support you can get for him. Comrade Syme and I have had an
experience which it would take more time to recount than we can afford,
if we are to act on it. I will, however, relate the occurrence in
detail, even at the risk of losing time, if you really feel that it is
essential to the understanding of the problem we have to discuss.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
As I say, the incident that has occurred to us and has led us to ask for
information about the Marquis, is one which you may think it better to
have narrated; but as it came in the way of Comrade Syme rather than
me
subQuotationList:
['As I say,', 'the incident that has occurred to us and has led us to ask for
information about the Marquis, is one which you may think it better to
have narrated; but as it came in the way of Comrade Syme rather than
me']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
You must go on. This devil
has sucked me dry!
subQuotationList: ['You must go on. This devil\nhas sucked me dry!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Yes, the thing really happened to me, I had the
good fortune to fall into conversation with a detective who took me,
thanks to my hat, for a respectable person. Wishing to clinch my
reputation for respectability, I took him and made him very drunk at
the Savoy. Under this influence he became friendly, and told me in so
many words that within a day or two they hope to arrest the Marquis in
France. So unless you or I can get on his track
subQuotationList:
['Yes, the thing really happened to me,', 'I had the
good fortune to fall into conversation with a detective who took me,
thanks to my hat, for a respectable person. Wishing to clinch my
reputation for respectability, I took him and made him very drunk at
the Savoy. Under this influence he became friendly, and told me in so
many words that within a day or two they hope to arrest the Marquis in
France.', 'So unless you or I can get on his track']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Syme immediately brought this information to me, and we came here
together to see what use you would be inclined to make of it. It seems
to me unquestionably urgent that
subQuotationList: ['Syme immediately brought this information to me, and we came here\ntogether to see what use you would be inclined to make of it. It seems\nto me unquestionably urgent that']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
I have an
intuition.
subQuotationList: ['I have an\nintuition.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
referringExpression: His message to his ally ran

quoteText: Then sit on it.
subQuotationList: ['Then sit on it.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
referringExpression: The Professor with scarcely a pause in his monologue signalled

quoteText: It is quite extraordinary.
subQuotationList: ['It is quite extraordinary.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Extraordinary rot!
subQuotationList: ['Extraordinary rot!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: I am a poet.
subQuotationList: ['I am a poet.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: You are a dead man.
subQuotationList: ['You are a dead man.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
You scarcely realise how poetic my intuition
is. It has that sudden quality we sometimes feel in the coming of
spring.
subQuotationList: ['You scarcely realise how poetic my intuition\nis. It has that sudden quality we sometimes feel in the coming of\nspring.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Go
to hell!
subQuotationList: ['Go\nto hell!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Perhaps I should rather say, that it
resembles that sudden smell of the sea which may be found in the heart
of lush woods.
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps I should rather say,', 'that it\nresembles that sudden smell of the sea which may be found in the heart\nof lush woods.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Or yet again, it is positive, as is the passionate red
hair of a beautiful woman.
subQuotationList: ['Or yet again,', 'it is positive, as is the passionate red\nhair of a beautiful woman.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Dr. Bull!
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Bull!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
referringExpression: He leant across the table and said

quoteText:
Dr. Bull, would you do me a small favour? Would you be so kind as to take off
your spectacles?
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Bull,', 'would you do me a small favour? Would you be so kind as to take off\nyour spectacles?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I knew I was a poet, I knew my
intuition was as infallible as the Pope. It was the spectacles that did
it! It was all the spectacles. Given those beastly black eyes, and all
the rest of him his health and his jolly looks, made him a live devil
among dead ones.
subQuotationList:
['I knew I was a poet,', 'I knew my
intuition was as infallible as the Pope. It was the spectacles that did
it! It was all the spectacles. Given those beastly black eyes, and all
the rest of him his health and his jolly looks, made him a live devil
among dead ones.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: It certainly does make a queer difference, But as regards the project of Dr. Bull
subQuotationList: ['It certainly does make a queer difference,', 'But as regards the project of Dr. Bull']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Project be damned! Look at him! Look at
his face, look at his collar, look at his blessed boots! You don't
suppose, do you, that that thing's an anarchist?
subQuotationList: ['Project be damned!', "Look at him! Look at\nhis face, look at his collar, look at his blessed boots! You don't\nsuppose, do you, that that thing's an anarchist?"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Syme!
subQuotationList: ['Syme!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Why, by God, I'll take the risk of that myself! Dr. Bull,
I am a police officer. There's my card,
subQuotationList: ['Why, by God,', "I'll take the risk of that myself! Dr. Bull,\nI am a police officer. There's my card,"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I'm awfully glad you chaps have come so early, for we can all start for France together. Yes,
I'm in the force right enough,
subQuotationList: ["I'm awfully glad you chaps have come so early,", "for we can all start for France together. Yes,\nI'm in the force right enough,"]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
But Lord God Almighty, if this is all right, there
were more damned detectives than there were damned dynamiters at the
damned Council!
subQuotationList: ['But Lord God Almighty,', 'if this is all right, there\nwere more damned detectives than there were damned dynamiters at the\ndamned Council!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: We might have fought easily, we were four against three.
subQuotationList: ['We might have fought easily,', 'we were four against three.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
No, we were not four against three we were not so
lucky. We were four against One.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'we were not four against three we were not so\nlucky. We were four against One.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
It is jolly to get some pals, I've been half dead with the
jumps, being quite alone. I nearly flung my arms round Gogol and
embraced him, which would have been imprudent. I hope you won't despise
me for having been in a blue funk.
subQuotationList:
['It is jolly to get some pals,', "I've been half dead with the
jumps, being quite alone. I nearly flung my arms round Gogol and
embraced him, which would have been imprudent. I hope you won't despise
me for having been in a blue funk."]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
All the blue devils in blue hell, contributed to my blue
funk! But the worst devil was you and your infernal goggles.
subQuotationList: ['All the blue devils in blue hell,', 'contributed to my blue\nfunk! But the worst devil was you and your infernal goggles.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Wasn't it a rag? Such a simple idea not my own. I haven't
got the brains. You see, I wanted to go into the detective service,
especially the anti-dynamite business. But for that purpose they wanted
someone to dress up as a dynamiter; and they all swore by blazes that I
could never look like a dynamiter. They said my very walk was
respectable, and that seen from behind I looked like the British
Constitution. They said I looked too healthy and too optimistic, and
too reliable and benevolent; they called me all sorts of names at
Scotland Yard. They said that if I had been a criminal, I might have
made my fortune by looking so like an honest man; but as I had the
misfortune to be an honest man, there was not even the remotest chance
of my assisting them by ever looking like a criminal. But at last I was
brought before some old josser who was high up in the force, and who
seemed to have no end of a head on his shoulders. And there the others
all talked hopelessly. One asked whether a bushy beard would hide my
nice smile; another said that if they blacked my face I might look like
a negro anarchist; but this old chap chipped in with a most
extraordinary remark. he said
positively. And so it was, by George! When once my eyes were
covered, all the rest, smile and big shoulders and short hair, made me
look a perfect little devil. As I say, it was simple enough when it was
done, like miracles; but that wasn't the really miraculous part of it.
There was one really staggering thing about the business, and my head
still turns at it.
subQuotationList:
["Wasn't it a rag?", "Such a simple idea not my own. I haven't
got the brains. You see, I wanted to go into the detective service,
especially the anti-dynamite business. But for that purpose they wanted

could never look like a dynamiter. They said my very walk was

positively.', "And so it was, by George! When once my eyes were

There was one really staggering thing about the business, and my head

speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Invisible Chief'], ['The Invisible Chief'], ['The Invisible Chief']], [], []]

quoteText: What was that?
subQuotationList: ['What was that?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I'll tell you, This big pot in the
police who sized me up so that he knew how the goggles would go with my
hair and socks by God, he never saw me at all!
subQuotationList: ["I'll tell you,", 'This big pot in the\npolice who sized me up so that he knew how the goggles would go with my\nhair and socks by God, he never saw me at all!']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['The Invisible Chief'], ['The Invisible Chief'], ['The Invisible Chief']]]

quoteText: How was that? I thought you talked to him.
subQuotationList: ['How was that?', 'I thought you talked to him.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
So I did, but we talked in a pitch-dark room
like a coalcellar. There, you would never have guessed that.
subQuotationList: ['So I did,', 'but we talked in a pitch-dark room\nlike a coalcellar. There, you would never have guessed that.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: I could not have conceived it,
subQuotationList: ['I could not have conceived it,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: It is indeed a new idea,
subQuotationList: ['It is indeed a new idea,']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
I had already arranged, to go to France for my lunch;
but I am delighted to have someone to lunch with me. You see, I had to
send that beast, the Marquis, over with his bomb, because the President
had his eye on me, though God knows how. I'll tell you the story some
day. It was perfectly choking. Whenever I tried to slip out of it I saw
the President somewhere, smiling out of the bow-window of a club, or
taking off his hat to me from the top of an omnibus. I tell you, you
can say what you like, that fellow sold himself to the devil; he can be
in six places at once.
subQuotationList:
['I had already arranged,', "to go to France for my lunch;
but I am delighted to have someone to lunch with me. You see, I had to
send that beast, the Marquis, over with his bomb, because the President
had his eye on me, though God knows how. I'll tell you the story some
day. It was perfectly choking. Whenever I tried to slip out of it I saw
the President somewhere, smiling out of the bow-window of a club, or
taking off his hat to me from the top of an omnibus. I tell you, you
can say what you like, that fellow sold himself to the devil; he can be
in six places at once."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
So you sent the Marquis off, I understand, Was
it long ago? Shall we be in time to catch him?
subQuotationList: ['So you sent the Marquis off, I understand,', 'Was\nit long ago? Shall we be in time to catch him?']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Bull'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe']]]

quoteText:
Yes, I've timed it all. He'll still be at
Calais when we arrive.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', "I've timed it all. He'll still be at\nCalais when we arrive."]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
But when we do catch him at Calais, what are we
going to do?
subQuotationList: ['But when we do catch him at Calais,', 'what are we\ngoing to do?']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Theoretically, I suppose, we ought to call the police.
subQuotationList: ['Theoretically, I suppose, we ought to call the police.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
referringExpression: He reflected a little and then said

quoteText:
Not I, Theoretically I ought to drown myself first. I
promised a poor fellow, who was a real modern pessimist, on my word of
honour not to tell the police. I'm no hand at casuistry, but I can't
break my word to a modern pessimist. It's like breaking one's word to a
child.
subQuotationList:
['Not I,', "Theoretically I ought to drown myself first. I
promised a poor fellow, who was a real modern pessimist, on my word of
honour not to tell the police. I'm no hand at casuistry, but I can't
break my word to a modern pessimist. It's like breaking one's word to a
child."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I'm in the same boat, I tried to tell the police
and I couldn't, because of some silly oath I took. You see, when I was
an actor I was a sort of all-round beast. Perjury or treason is the
only crime I haven't committed. If I did that I shouldn't know the
difference between right and wrong.
subQuotationList:
["I'm in the same boat,", "I tried to tell the police
and I couldn't, because of some silly oath I took. You see, when I was
an actor I was a sort of all-round beast. Perjury or treason is the
only crime I haven't committed. If I did that I shouldn't know the
difference between right and wrong."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
I've been through all that, and I've made up my mind.
I gave my promise to the Secretary you know him, man who smiles upside
down. My friends, that man is the most utterly unhappy man that was
ever human. It may be his digestion, or his conscience, or his nerves,
or his philosophy of the universe, but he's damned, he's in hell! Well,
I can't turn on a man like that, and hunt him down. It's like whipping
a leper. I may be mad, but that's how I feel; and there's jolly well
the end of it.
subQuotationList:
["I've been through all that,", "and I've made up my mind.
I gave my promise to the Secretary you know him, man who smiles upside
down. My friends, that man is the most utterly unhappy man that was
ever human. It may be his digestion, or his conscience, or his nerves,
or his philosophy of the universe, but he's damned, he's in hell! Well,
I can't turn on a man like that, and hunt him down. It's like whipping
a leper. I may be mad, but that's how I feel; and there's jolly well
the end of it."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The Secretary'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary']]]

quoteText:
I don't think you're mad, I knew you would decide like
that when first you
subQuotationList: ["I don't think you're mad,", 'I knew you would decide like\nthat when first you']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Eh?
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: When first you took off your spectacles.
subQuotationList: ['When first you took off your spectacles.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Well, it seems that we have all the same kind of morality
or immorality, so we had better face the fact that comes of it.
subQuotationList: ['Well,', 'it seems that we have all the same kind of morality\nor immorality, so we had better face the fact that comes of it.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Yes, you're quite right; and we must hurry
up, for I can see the Grey Nose standing out from France.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', "you're quite right; and we must hurry\nup, for I can see the Grey Nose standing out from France."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
The fact that comes of it, is this, that we
three are alone on this planet. Gogol has gone, God knows where;
perhaps the President has smashed him like a fly. On the Council we are
three men against three, like the Romans who held the bridge. But we
are worse off than that, first because they can appeal to their
organization and we cannot appeal to ours, and second because
subQuotationList:
['The fact that comes of it,', 'is this, that we
three are alone on this planet. Gogol has gone, God knows where;
perhaps the President has smashed him like a fly. On the Council we are
three men against three, like the Romans who held the bridge. But we
are worse off than that, first because they can appeal to their
organization and we cannot appeal to ours, and second because']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gogol'], ['The President'], ['Gogol'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Secretary', 'The President', 'Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['The Secretary', 'The President', 'Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Professor']]]

quoteText:
Because one of those other three men, is not a
man.
subQuotationList: ['Because one of those other three men,', 'is not a\nman.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
My idea is this. We must do something to keep the Marquis in Calais
till tomorrow midday. I have turned over twenty schemes in my head. We
cannot denounce him as a dynamiter; that is agreed. We cannot get him
detained on some trivial charge, for we should have to appear; he knows
us, and he would smell a rat. We cannot pretend to keep him on
anarchist business; he might swallow much in that way, but not the
notion of stopping in Calais while the Czar went safely through Paris.
We might try to kidnap him, and lock him up ourselves; but he is a
well-known man here. He has a whole bodyguard of friends; he is very
strong and brave, and the event is doubtful. The only thing I can see
to do is actually to take advantage of the very things that are in the
Marquis's favour. I am going to profit by the fact that he is a highly
respected nobleman. I am going to profit by the fact that he has many
friends and moves in the best society.
subQuotationList:
["My idea is this. We must do something to keep the Marquis in Calais
till tomorrow midday. I have turned over twenty schemes in my head. We
cannot denounce him as a dynamiter; that is agreed. We cannot get him
detained on some trivial charge, for we should have to appear; he knows
us, and he would smell a rat. We cannot pretend to keep him on
anarchist business; he might swallow much in that way, but not the
notion of stopping in Calais while the Czar went safely through Paris.
We might try to kidnap him, and lock him up ourselves; but he is a
well-known man here. He has a whole bodyguard of friends; he is very
strong and brave, and the event is doubtful. The only thing I can see
to do is actually to take advantage of the very things that are in the
Marquis's favour. I am going to profit by the fact that he is a highly
respected nobleman. I am going to profit by the fact that he has many
friends and moves in the best society."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe']]]

quoteText: What the devil are you talking about?
subQuotationList: ['What the devil are you talking about?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
The Symes are first mentioned in the fourteenth century, but there is a tradition that one of them rode behind Bruce at
Bannockburn. Since 1350 the tree is quite clear.
subQuotationList: ['The Symes are first mentioned in the fourteenth century,', 'but there is a tradition that one of them rode behind Bruce at\nBannockburn. Since 1350 the tree is quite clear.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: He's gone off his head,
subQuotationList: ["He's gone off his head,"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
Our bearings, are  argent a chevron gules
charged with three cross crosslets of the field.' The motto varies.
subQuotationList: ['Our bearings,', "are  argent a chevron gules\ncharged with three cross crosslets of the field.' The motto varies."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
We are just inshore, Are you seasick or joking in the wrong
place?
subQuotationList: ['We are just inshore,', 'Are you seasick or joking in the wrong\nplace?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
My remarks are almost painfully practical, The house of St. Eustache also is very ancient. The
Marquis cannot deny that he is a gentleman. He cannot deny that I am a
gentleman. And in order to put the matter of my social position quite
beyond a doubt, I propose at the earliest opportunity to knock his hat
off. But here we are in the harbour.
subQuotationList:
['My remarks are almost painfully practical,', 'The house of St. Eustache also is very ancient. The
Marquis cannot deny that he is a gentleman. He cannot deny that I am a
gentleman. And in order to put the matter of my social position quite
beyond a doubt, I propose at the earliest opportunity to knock his hat
off. But here we are in the harbour.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
I shall approach. Before taking off his hat, I shall take off my own.
I shall say,
subQuotationList: ['I shall approach. Before taking off his hat, I shall take off my own.\nI shall say,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: He will say,
subQuotationList: ['He will say,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
He will say in the most exquisite
French,
subQuotationList: ['He will say in the most exquisite\nFrench,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: I shall reply in the most exquisite Cockney,
subQuotationList: ['I shall reply in the most exquisite Cockney,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Oh, shut it, Pull yourself together, and
chuck away that bit of paper. What are you really going to do?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, shut it,', 'Pull yourself together, and\nchuck away that bit of paper. What are you really going to do?']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
But it was a lovely catechism, Do let me
read it you. It has only forty-three questions and answers, and some of
the Marquis's answers are wonderfully witty. I like to be just to my
enemy.
subQuotationList:
['But it was a lovely catechism,', "Do let me
read it you. It has only forty-three questions and answers, and some of
the Marquis's answers are wonderfully witty. I like to be just to my
enemy."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: But what's the good of it all?
subQuotationList: ["But what's the good of it all?"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
It leads up to my challenge, don't you see, When
the Marquis has given the thirty-ninth reply, which runs
subQuotationList: ["It leads up to my challenge, don't you see,", 'When\nthe Marquis has given the thirty-ninth reply, which runs']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Has it by any chance occurred to you, that the Marquis may not say all the forty-three
things you have put down for him? In that case, I understand, your own
epigrams may appear somewhat more forced.
subQuotationList: ['Has it by any chance occurred to you,', 'that the Marquis may not say all the forty-three\nthings you have put down for him? In that case, I understand, your own\nepigrams may appear somewhat more forced.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Why, how true that is, and I never thought of it. Sir, you
have an intellect beyond the common. You will make a name.
subQuotationList: ['Why, how true that is,', 'and I never thought of it. Sir, you\nhave an intellect beyond the common. You will make a name.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms'], ['Professor De Worms'], ['Professor De Worms']]]

quoteText: Oh, you're as drunk as an owl!
subQuotationList: ["Oh, you're as drunk as an owl!"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
It only remains, to adopt some
other method of breaking the ice (if I may so express it) between
myself and the man I wish to kill. And since the course of a dialogue
cannot be predicted by one of its parties alone (as you have pointed
out with such recondite acumen), the only thing to be done, I suppose,
is for the one party, as far as possible, to do all the dialogue by
himself. And so I will, by George!
subQuotationList:
['It only remains,', 'to adopt some
other method of breaking the ice (if I may so express it) between
myself and the man I wish to kill. And since the course of a dialogue
cannot be predicted by one of its parties alone (as you have pointed
out with such recondite acumen), the only thing to be done, I suppose,
is for the one party, as far as possible, to do all the dialogue by
himself. And so I will, by George!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Are you going to address the meeting?
subQuotationList: ['Are you going to address the meeting?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
I am, that meeting. That meeting displeases me. I am going to pull that
meeting's great ugly, mahogany-coloured nose.
subQuotationList: ['I am,', "that meeting. That meeting displeases me. I am going to pull that\nmeeting's great ugly, mahogany-coloured nose."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: You are Mr. Syme, I think,
subQuotationList: ['You are Mr. Syme, I think,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: And you are the Marquis de Saint Eustache, Permit me to pull your nose.
subQuotationList: ['And you are the Marquis de Saint Eustache,', 'Permit me to pull your nose.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: This man has insulted me!
subQuotationList: ['This man has insulted me!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Insulted you? when?
subQuotationList: ['Insulted you?', 'when?']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
referringExpression: cried the gentleman with the red rosette

quoteText: Oh, just now, He insulted my mother.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, just now,', 'He insulted my mother.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Insulted your mother!
subQuotationList: ['Insulted your mother!']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: Well, anyhow, my aunt.
subQuotationList: ['Well, anyhow,', 'my aunt.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
But how can the Marquis have insulted your aunt just now? He has been sitting here
all the time.
subQuotationList: ['But how can the Marquis have insulted your aunt just now?', 'He has been sitting here\nall the time.']
speaker: The Second Gentleman

quoteText: Ah, it was what he said!
subQuotationList: ['Ah, it was what he said!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I said nothing at all, except something about the
band. I only said that I liked Wagner played well.
subQuotationList: ['I said nothing at all,', 'except something about the\nband. I only said that I liked Wagner played well.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
It was an allusion to my family, My aunt played
Wagner badly. It was a painful subject. We are always being insulted
about it.
subQuotationList: ['It was an allusion to my family,', 'My aunt played\nWagner badly. It was a painful subject. We are always being insulted\nabout it.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: This seems most extraordinary,
subQuotationList: ['This seems most extraordinary,']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
Oh, I assure you, the whole of your
conversation was simply packed with sinister allusions to my aunt's
weaknesses.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, I assure you,', "the whole of your\nconversation was simply packed with sinister allusions to my aunt's\nweaknesses."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
This is nonsense! I for one have said
nothing for half an hour except that I liked the singing of that girl
with black hair.
subQuotationList: ['This is nonsense!', 'I for one have said\nnothing for half an hour except that I liked the singing of that girl\nwith black hair.']
speaker: The Second Gentleman

quoteText:
Well, there you are again! My aunt's was
red.
subQuotationList: ['Well, there you are again!', "My aunt's was\nred."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
It seems to me, that you are simply seeking a
pretext to insult the Marquis.
subQuotationList: ['It seems to me,', 'that you are simply seeking a\npretext to insult the Marquis.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
By George! what a clever
chap you are!
subQuotationList: ['By George!', 'what a clever\nchap you are!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Seeking a quarrel with me! Seeking a fight with me! By
God! there was never a man who had to seek long. These gentlemen will
perhaps act for me. There are still four hours of daylight. Let us
fight this evening.
subQuotationList:
['Seeking a quarrel with me!', 'Seeking a fight with me! By
God! there was never a man who had to seek long. These gentlemen will
perhaps act for me. There are still four hours of daylight. Let us
fight this evening.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
Marquis, your action is worthy of your fame and blood.
Permit me to consult for a moment with the gentlemen in whose hands I
shall place myself.
subQuotationList: ['Marquis,', 'your action is worthy of your fame and blood.\nPermit me to consult for a moment with the gentlemen in whose hands I\nshall place myself.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I have done it, I have fixed a fight on the beast.
But look here, and listen carefully. There is no time for talk. You are
my seconds, and everything must come from you. Now you must insist, and
insist absolutely, on the duel coming off after seven tomorrow, so as
to give me the chance of preventing him from catching the 7.45 for
Paris. If he misses that he misses his crime. He can't refuse to meet
you on such a small point of time and place. But this is what he will
do. He will choose a field somewhere near a wayside station, where he
can pick up the train. He is a very good swordsman, and he will trust
to killing me in time to catch it. But I can fence well too, and I
think I can keep him in play, at any rate, until the train is lost.
Then perhaps he may kill me to console his feelings. You understand?
Very well then, let me introduce you to some charming friends of mine,
subQuotationList:
['I have done it,', "I have fixed a fight on the beast.
But look here, and listen carefully. There is no time for talk. You are
my seconds, and everything must come from you. Now you must insist, and
insist absolutely, on the duel coming off after seven tomorrow, so as
to give me the chance of preventing him from catching the 7.45 for
Paris. If he misses that he misses his crime. He can't refuse to meet
you on such a small point of time and place. But this is what he will
do. He will choose a field somewhere near a wayside station, where he
can pick up the train. He is a very good swordsman, and he will trust
to killing me in time to catch it. But I can fence well too, and I
think I can keep him in play, at any rate, until the train is lost.
Then perhaps he may kill me to console his feelings. You understand?
Very well then, let me introduce you to some charming friends of mine,"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Second Gentleman']]]

quoteText:
To a man of the well-known skill and valour of Monsieur de St.
Eustache, it must be a matter of
indifference which method is adopted, and our principal has strong
reasons for demanding the longer encounter, reasons the delicacy of
which prevent me from being explicit, but for the just and honourable
nature of which I can
subQuotationList:
['To a man of the well-known skill and valour of Monsieur de St.
Eustache,', 'it must be a matter of
indifference which method is adopted, and our principal has strong
reasons for demanding the longer encounter, reasons the delicacy of
which prevent me from being explicit, but for the just and honourable
nature of which I can']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: _Peste!_ let us stop talking and begin,
subQuotationList: ['_Peste!_', 'let us stop talking and begin,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Engage!
subQuotationList: ['Engage!']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
After all, I am more
than a devil; I am a man. I can do the one thing which Satan himself
cannot do I can die,
subQuotationList: ['After all,', 'I am more\nthan a devil; I am a man. I can do the one thing which Satan himself\ncannot do I can die,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Stop! I want to say something.
subQuotationList: ['Stop!', 'I want to say something.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
What is the matter? Has there been
foul play?
subQuotationList: ['What is the matter?', 'Has there been\nfoul play?']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
There has been foul play somewhere, Our principal has wounded the Marquis four times at least, and
he is none the worse.
subQuotationList: ['There has been foul play somewhere,', 'Our principal has wounded the Marquis four times at least, and\nhe is none the worse.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText: Please let me speak,
subQuotationList: ['Please let me speak,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
It is rather important. Mr. Syme, we are fighting today, if I
remember right, because you expressed a wish (which I thought
irrational) to pull my nose. Would you oblige me by pulling my nose now
as quickly as possible? I have to catch a train.
subQuotationList:
['It is rather important. Mr. Syme,', 'we are fighting today, if I
remember right, because you expressed a wish (which I thought
irrational) to pull my nose. Would you oblige me by pulling my nose now
as quickly as possible? I have to catch a train.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText: I protest that this is most irregular,
subQuotationList: ['I protest that this is most irregular,']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
It is certainly somewhat opposed to precedent, There is, I think, one case on
record (Captain Bellegarde and the Baron Zumpt) in which the weapons
were changed in the middle of the encounter at the request of one of
the combatants. But one can hardly call one's nose a weapon.
subQuotationList:
['It is certainly somewhat opposed to precedent,', "There is, I think, one case on
record (Captain Bellegarde and the Baron Zumpt) in which the weapons
were changed in the middle of the encounter at the request of one of
the combatants. But one can hardly call one's nose a weapon."]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
Will you or will you not pull my nose? Come, come, Mr. Syme! You wanted to do it, do it! You
can have no conception of how important it is to me. Don't be so
selfish! Pull my nose at once, when I ask you!
subQuotationList: ['Will you or will you not pull my nose?', "Come, come, Mr. Syme! You wanted to do it, do it! You\ncan have no conception of how important it is to me. Don't be so\nselfish! Pull my nose at once, when I ask you!"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme']], [['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
If anyone has any use for my left eyebrow, he can have it.
Colonel Ducroix, do accept my left eyebrow! It's the kind of thing that
might come in useful any day,
subQuotationList: ['If anyone has any use for my left eyebrow,', "he can have it.\nColonel Ducroix, do accept my left eyebrow! It's the kind of thing that\nmight come in useful any day,"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
If I had known, that I was acting for a poltroon who
pads himself to fight
subQuotationList: ['If I had known,', 'that I was acting for a poltroon who\npads himself to fight']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
Oh, I know, I know! You are making a
mistake; but it can't be explained just now. I tell you the train has
come into the station!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, I know, I know!', "You are making a\nmistake; but it can't be explained just now. I tell you the train has\ncome into the station!"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
Yes, and the train shall go out of the
station. It shall go out without you. We know well enough for what
devil's work
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', "and the train shall go out of the\nstation. It shall go out without you. We know well enough for what\ndevil's work"]
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText: Will you drive me mad? The train
subQuotationList: ['Will you drive me mad?', 'The train']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText: You shall not go by the train,
subQuotationList: ['You shall not go by the train,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
You great fat, blasted, blear-eyed, blundering, thundering, brainless,
Godforsaken, doddering, damned fool! You great silly, pink-faced, towheaded turnip! You
subQuotationList: ['You great fat, blasted, blear-eyed, blundering, thundering, brainless,\nGodforsaken, doddering, damned fool!', 'You great silly, pink-faced, towheaded turnip! You']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionTextsList: [['You great fat, blasted, blear-eyed, blundering, thundering, brainless,\nGodforsaken, doddering, damned fool'], ['You great silly, pink-faced, towheaded turnip', 'You']]

quoteText: You shall not go by this train,
subQuotationList: ['You shall not go by this train,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
And why the infernal blazes, should I want to go
by the train?
subQuotationList: ['And why the infernal blazes,', 'should I want to go\nby the train?']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
We know all, You are going to Paris to
throw a bomb!
subQuotationList: ['We know all,', 'You are going to Paris to\nthrow a bomb!']
speaker: Professor De Worms
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText: Going to Jericho to throw a Jabberwock!
subQuotationList: ['Going to Jericho to throw a Jabberwock!']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
Have you all got softening of the brain, that you don't realise what I
am? Did you really think I wanted to catch that train? Twenty Paris
trains might go by for me. Damn Paris trains!
subQuotationList: ["Have you all got softening of the brain, that you don't realise what I\nam? Did you really think I wanted to catch that train? Twenty Paris\ntrains might go by for me. Damn Paris trains!"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms'], ['Professor De Worms'], ['Professor De Worms']]]

quoteText: Then what did you care about?
subQuotationList: ['Then what did you care about?']
speaker: Professor De Worms
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
What did I care about? I didn't care about catching the train; I cared
about whether the train caught me, and now, by God! it has caught me.
subQuotationList: ["What did I care about? I didn't care about catching the train; I cared\nabout whether the train caught me, and now, by God! it has caught me."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
I regret to inform you, that your remarks
convey no impression to my mind. Perhaps if you were to remove the
remains of your original forehead and some portion of what was once
your chin, your meaning would become clearer. Mental lucidity fulfils
itself in many ways. What do you mean by saying that the train has
caught you? It may be my literary fancy, but somehow I feel that it
ought to mean something.
subQuotationList:
['I regret to inform you,', 'that your remarks
convey no impression to my mind. Perhaps if you were to remove the
remains of your original forehead and some portion of what was once
your chin, your meaning would become clearer. Mental lucidity fulfils
itself in many ways. What do you mean by saying that the train has
caught you? It may be my literary fancy, but somehow I feel that it
ought to mean something.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Inspector Ratcliffe']], [['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe']]]

quoteText:
It means everything, and the end of everything.
Sunday has us now in the hollow of his hand.
subQuotationList: ['It means everything,', 'and the end of everything.\nSunday has us now in the hollow of his hand.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText: Us!
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
What do you mean by
 us'?
subQuotationList: ["What do you mean by\n us'?"]
speaker: Professor De Worms
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Dr. Bull', 'Professor De Worms']]]

quoteText: The police, of course!
subQuotationList: ['The police, of course!']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
I am Inspector Ratcliffe, My name is pretty well known to the police, and I can
see well enough that you belong to them. But if there is any doubt
about my position, I have a card,
subQuotationList: ['I am Inspector Ratcliffe,', 'My name is pretty well known to the police, and I can\nsee well enough that you belong to them. But if there is any doubt\nabout my position, I have a card,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']

quoteText:
Oh, don't show it us, we've got enough of them to
equip a paper-chase.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, don't show it us,", "we've got enough of them to\nequip a paper-chase."]
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Gentlemen, we all owe you a serious apology; but I assure
you that you have not been made the victims of such a low joke as you
imagine, or indeed of anything undignified in a man of honour. You have
not wasted your time; you have helped to save the world. We are not
buffoons, but very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy. A
secret society of anarchists is hunting us like hares; not such
unfortunate madmen as may here or there throw a bomb through starvation
or German philosophy, but a rich and powerful and fanatical church, a
church of eastern pessimism, which holds it holy to destroy mankind
like vermin. How hard they hunt us you can gather from the fact that we
are driven to such disguises as those for which I apologise, and to
such pranks as this one by which you suffer.
subQuotationList:
['Gentlemen,', 'we all owe you a serious apology; but I assure
you that you have not been made the victims of such a low joke as you
imagine, or indeed of anything undignified in a man of honour. You have
not wasted your time; you have helped to save the world. We are not
buffoons, but very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy. A
secret society of anarchists is hunting us like hares; not such
unfortunate madmen as may here or there throw a bomb through starvation
or German philosophy, but a rich and powerful and fanatical church, a
church of eastern pessimism, which holds it holy to destroy mankind
like vermin. How hard they hunt us you can gather from the fact that we
are driven to such disguises as those for which I apologise, and to
such pranks as this one by which you suffer.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President', 'The Secretary'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix']]]

quoteText:
Of course, I accept the apology; but you will in your turn forgive me
if I decline to follow you further into your difficulties, and permit
myself to say good morning! The sight of an acquaintance and
distinguished fellow-townsman coming to pieces in the open air is
unusual, and, upon the whole, sufficient for one day. Colonel Ducroix,
I would in no way influence your actions, but if you feel with me that
our present society is a little abnormal, I am now going to walk back
to the town.
subQuotationList:
['Of course, I accept the apology; but you will in your turn forgive me
if I decline to follow you further into your difficulties, and permit
myself to say good morning! The sight of an acquaintance and
distinguished fellow-townsman coming to pieces in the open air is
unusual, and, upon the whole, sufficient for one day. Colonel Ducroix,
I would in no way influence your actions, but if you feel with me that
our present society is a little abnormal, I am now going to walk back
to the town.']
speaker: The Second Gentleman
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
referringExpression: a short man with a black moustache bowed politely and said
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Colonel Ducroix'], ['The Second Gentleman', 'Colonel Ducroix']]]

quoteText:
No, by George! I won't. If these gentlemen are really in a mess with a
lot of low wreckers like that, I'll see them through it. I have fought
for France, and it is hard if I can't fight for civilization.
subQuotationList: ["No, by George! I won't. If these gentlemen are really in a mess with a\nlot of low wreckers like that, I'll see them through it. I have fought\nfor France, and it is hard if I can't fight for civilization."]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Second Gentleman']
referringExpression: Colonel Ducroix moved mechanically but then tugged abruptly at his white moustache and broke out
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor'], ['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor']]]

quoteText:
Don't make too much noise, Sunday may hear
you.
subQuotationList: ["Don't make too much noise,", 'Sunday may hear\nyou.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: Sunday!
subQuotationList: ['Sunday!']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Yes, he may be with them.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', 'he may be with them.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: With whom?
subQuotationList: ['With whom?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: With the people out of that train,
subQuotationList: ['With the people out of that train,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: What you say seems utterly wild,
subQuotationList: ['What you say seems utterly wild,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Why, as a matter of
fact But, my God, by God! if this is true the whole bally lot
of us on the Anarchist Council were against anarchy! Every born man was
a detective except the President and his personal secretary. What can
it mean?
subQuotationList:
['Why, as a matter of
fact But, my God,', 'by God! if this is true the whole bally lot
of us on the Anarchist Council were against anarchy! Every born man was
a detective except the President and his personal secretary. What can
it mean?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
Mean! It means that
we are struck dead! Don't you know Sunday? Don't you know that his
jokes are always so big and simple that one has never thought of them?
Can you think of anything more like Sunday than this, that he should
put all his powerful enemies on the Supreme Council, and then take care
that it was not supreme? I tell you he has bought every trust, he has
captured every cable, he has control of every railway line especially
of _that_ railway line! The whole movement was controlled by him; half
the world was ready to rise for him. But there were just five people,
perhaps, who would have resisted him... and the old devil put them on
the Supreme Council, to waste their time in watching each other. Idiots
that we are, he planned the whole of our idiocies! Sunday knew that the
Professor would chase Syme through London, and that Syme would fight me
in France. And he was combining great masses of capital, and seizing
great lines of telegraphy, while we five idiots were running after each
other like a lot of confounded babies playing blind man's buff.
subQuotationList:
['Mean!', "It means that
we are struck dead! Don't you know Sunday? Don't you know that his
jokes are always so big and simple that one has never thought of them?
Can you think of anything more like Sunday than this, that he should
put all his powerful enemies on the Supreme Council, and then take care
that it was not supreme? I tell you he has bought every trust, he has
captured every cable, he has control of every railway line especially
of _that_ railway line!", "The whole movement was controlled by him; half
the world was ready to rise for him. But there were just five people,
perhaps, who would have resisted him... and the old devil put them on
the Supreme Council, to waste their time in watching each other. Idiots
that we are, he planned the whole of our idiocies! Sunday knew that the
Professor would chase Syme through London, and that Syme would fight me
in France. And he was combining great masses of capital, and seizing
great lines of telegraphy, while we five idiots were running after each
other like a lot of confounded babies playing blind man's buff."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President']], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor', 'Gogol'], ['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor', 'Gogol'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Well?
subQuotationList: ['Well?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Well, he has found us
playing blind man's buff today in a field of great rustic beauty and
extreme solitude. He has probably captured the world; it only remains
to him to capture this field and all the fools in it. And since you
really want to know what was my objection to the arrival of that train,
I will tell you. My objection was that Sunday or his Secretary has just
this moment got out of it.
subQuotationList:
['Well,', "he has found us
playing blind man's buff today in a field of great rustic beauty and
extreme solitude. He has probably captured the world; it only remains
to him to capture this field and all the fools in it. And since you
really want to know what was my objection to the arrival of that train,
I will tell you. My objection was that Sunday or his Secretary has just
this moment got out of it."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The Secretary']]]

quoteText:
It was a habit of the late Marquis de St. Eustache, always to carry a pair of opera
glasses. Either the President or the Secretary is coming after us with
that mob. They have caught us in a nice quiet place where we are under
no temptations to break our oaths by calling the police. Dr. Bull, I
have a suspicion that you will see better through these than through
your own highly decorative spectacles.
subQuotationList:
['It was a habit of the late Marquis de St. Eustache,', 'always to carry a pair of opera
glasses. Either the President or the Secretary is coming after us with
that mob. They have caught us in a nice quiet place where we are under
no temptations to break our oaths by calling the police. Dr. Bull, I
have a suspicion that you will see better through these than through
your own highly decorative spectacles.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The President'], ['The Secretary'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President', 'The Secretary'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull']]]

quoteText:
It cannot be as bad as you say, There are a good number of them certainly, but they may easily be
ordinary tourists.
subQuotationList: ['It cannot be as bad as you say,', 'There are a good number of them certainly, but they may easily be\nordinary tourists.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Do ordinary tourists, wear black masks half-way down the face?
subQuotationList: ['Do ordinary tourists,', 'wear black masks half-way down the face?']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: The President is not with them, anyhow,
subQuotationList: ['The President is not with them, anyhow,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
But surely they are right away on the horizon, Could you possibly know your President among all
those people?
subQuotationList: ['But surely they are right away on the horizon,', 'Could you possibly know your President among all\nthose people?']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

subQuotationList: ['Could I know a white elephant among all those people!', 'As you very truly say, they are on the horizon;\nbut if he were walking with them... by God! I believe this ground would\nshake.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Of course the President isn't with them. I wish to Gemini he were.
Much more likely the President is riding in triumph through Paris, or
sitting on the ruins of St. Paul's Cathedral.
subQuotationList: ["Of course the President isn't with them. I wish to Gemini he were.\nMuch more likely the President is riding in triumph through Paris, or\nsitting on the ruins of St. Paul's Cathedral."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: This is absurd!
subQuotationList: ['This is absurd!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Something may have happened in our
absence; but he cannot have carried the world with a rush like that. It
is quite true, it is certainly true that there seems
to be a crowd coming this way; but they are not all the army that you
make out.
subQuotationList:
['Something may have happened in our
absence; but he cannot have carried the world with a rush like that. It
is quite true,', 'it is certainly true that there seems
to be a crowd coming this way; but they are not all the army that you
make out.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Oh, they, no they are not a
very valuable force. But let me tell you frankly that they are
precisely calculated to our value we are not much, my boy, in Sunday's
universe. He has got hold of all the cables and telegraphs himself. But
to kill the Supreme Council he regards as a trivial matter, like a post
card; it may be left to his private secretary,
subQuotationList:
['Oh, they,', "no they are not a
very valuable force. But let me tell you frankly that they are
precisely calculated to our value we are not much, my boy, in Sunday's
universe. He has got hold of all the cables and telegraphs himself. But
to kill the Supreme Council he regards as a trivial matter, like a post
card; it may be left to his private secretary,"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
There is a great deal to be said for death; but if anyone has any
preference for the other alternative, I strongly advise him to walk
after me.
subQuotationList: ['There is a great deal to be said for death; but if anyone has any\npreference for the other alternative, I strongly advise him to walk\nafter me.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
referringExpression: he turned to the others and said

quoteText: May I ask, where on earth we are all going to?
subQuotationList: ['May I ask,', 'where on earth we are all going to?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
We must get down through the town of Lancy to the sea, I
think that part of the country is least likely to be with them.
subQuotationList: ['We must get down through the town of Lancy to the sea,', 'I\nthink that part of the country is least likely to be with them.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], []]

quoteText:
What can you mean by all this? They can't be running the
real world in that way. Surely not many working men are anarchists, and
surely if they were, mere mobs could not beat modern armies and
police.
subQuotationList:
['What can you mean by all this?', "They can't be running the
real world in that way. Surely not many working men are anarchists, and
surely if they were, mere mobs could not beat modern armies and
police."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Mere mobs! So you
talk about mobs and the working classes as if they were the question.
You've got that eternal idiotic idea that if anarchy came it would come
from the poor. Why should it? The poor have been rebels, but they have
never been anarchists; they have more interest than anyone else in
there being some decent government. The poor man really has a stake in
the country. The rich man hasn't; he can go away to New Guinea in a
yacht. The poor have sometimes objected to being governed badly; the
rich have always objected to being governed at all. Aristocrats were
always anarchists, as you can see from the barons' wars.
subQuotationList:
['Mere mobs!', "So you
talk about mobs and the working classes as if they were the question.
You've got that eternal idiotic idea that if anarchy came it would come
from the poor. Why should it? The poor have been rebels, but they have
never been anarchists; they have more interest than anyone else in
there being some decent government. The poor man really has a stake in
the country. The rich man hasn't; he can go away to New Guinea in a
yacht. The poor have sometimes objected to being governed badly; the
rich have always objected to being governed at all. Aristocrats were
always anarchists, as you can see from the barons' wars."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
As a lecture on English history for the little ones, this
is all very nice; but I have not yet grasped its application.
subQuotationList: ['As a lecture on English history for the little ones,', 'this\nis all very nice; but I have not yet grasped its application.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Its application is, that most of old Sunday's
right-hand men are South African and American millionaires. That is why
he has got hold of all the communications; and that is why the last
four champions of the anti-anarchist police force are running through a
wood like rabbits.
subQuotationList:
['Its application is,', "that most of old Sunday's
right-hand men are South African and American millionaires. That is why
he has got hold of all the communications; and that is why the last
four champions of the anti-anarchist police force are running through a
wood like rabbits."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
Millionaires I can understand, they are
nearly all mad. But getting hold of a few wicked old gentlemen with
hobbies is one thing; getting hold of great Christian nations is
another. I would bet the nose off my face (forgive the allusion) that
Sunday would stand perfectly helpless before the task of converting any
ordinary healthy person anywhere.
subQuotationList:
['Millionaires I can understand,', 'they are
nearly all mad. But getting hold of a few wicked old gentlemen with
hobbies is one thing; getting hold of great Christian nations is
another. I would bet the nose off my face (forgive the allusion) that
Sunday would stand perfectly helpless before the task of converting any
ordinary healthy person anywhere.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Well, it rather depends what sort of person you
mean.
subQuotationList: ['Well,', 'it rather depends what sort of person you\nmean.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: Well, for instance, he could never convert that person,
subQuotationList: ['Well, for instance,', 'he could never convert that person,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Mr. Syme is saying, that
this man, at least, will never be an anarchist.
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Syme is saying,', 'that\nthis man, at least, will never be an anarchist.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
referringExpression: called out Ratcliffe to the French Colonel

quoteText:
