Mr. Syme is right enough there, if only for the reason that he has plenty of property to defend. But I
forgot that in your country you are not used to peasants being
wealthy.
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Syme is right enough there,', 'if only for the reason that he has plenty of property to defend. But I\nforgot that in your country you are not used to peasants being\nwealthy.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: He looks poor,
subQuotationList: ['He looks poor,']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Quite so, that is why he is rich.
subQuotationList: ['Quite so,', 'that is why he is rich.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
I have an idea, how much would he take
to give us a lift in his cart? Those dogs are all on foot, and we could
soon leave them behind.
subQuotationList: ['I have an idea,', 'how much would he take\nto give us a lift in his cart? Those dogs are all on foot, and we could\nsoon leave them behind.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Oh, give him anything! I have piles of money on
me.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, give him anything!', 'I have piles of money on\nme.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
That will never do, he will never have any respect
for you unless you drive a bargain.
subQuotationList: ['That will never do,', 'he will never have any respect\nfor you unless you drive a bargain.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: Oh, if he haggles!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, if he haggles!']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
He haggles because he is a free man, You do not
understand; he would not see the meaning of generosity. He is not being
tipped.
subQuotationList: ['He haggles because he is a free man,', 'You do not\nunderstand; he would not see the meaning of generosity. He is not being\ntipped.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
Yes, that's discipline. That's Sunday. He is
perhaps five hundred miles off, but the fear of him is on all of them,
like the finger of God. Yes, they are walking regularly; and you bet
your boots that they are talking regularly, yes, and thinking
regularly. But the one important thing for us is that they are
disappearing regularly.
subQuotationList:
['Yes,', "that's discipline. That's Sunday. He is
perhaps five hundred miles off, but the fear of him is on all of them,
like the finger of God. Yes, they are walking regularly; and you bet
your boots that they are talking regularly, yes, and thinking
regularly. But the one important thing for us is that they are
disappearing regularly."]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
May I ask you, Colonel, why we have come
here?
subQuotationList: ['May I ask you, Colonel,', 'why we have come\nhere?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Colonel Ducroix'], ['Colonel Ducroix']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
For two reasons, sir, and I will give first, not the most
important, but the most utilitarian. We came here because this is the
only place within twenty miles in which we can get horses.
subQuotationList: ['For two reasons, sir,', 'and I will give first, not the most\nimportant, but the most utilitarian. We came here because this is the\nonly place within twenty miles in which we can get horses.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Horses!
subQuotationList: ['Horses!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Yes, if you people are really to distance your
enemies it is horses or nothing for you, unless of course you have
bicycles and motor-cars in your pocket.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', 'if you people are really to distance your\nenemies it is horses or nothing for you, unless of course you have\nbicycles and motor-cars in your pocket.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: And where do you advise us to make for?
subQuotationList: ['And where do you advise us to make for?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Colonel Ducroix'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Beyond question, you had better make all haste
to the police station beyond the town. My friend, whom I seconded under
somewhat deceptive circumstances, seems to me to exaggerate very much
the possibilities of a general rising; but even he would hardly
maintain, I suppose, that you were not safe with the gendarmes.
subQuotationList:
['Beyond question,', 'you had better make all haste
to the police station beyond the town. My friend, whom I seconded under
somewhat deceptive circumstances, seems to me to exaggerate very much
the possibilities of a general rising; but even he would hardly
maintain, I suppose, that you were not safe with the gendarmes.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: And your other reason for coming here?
subQuotationList: ['And your other reason for coming here?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
My other reason for coming here, is that it is
just as well to see a good man or two when one is possibly near to
death.
subQuotationList: ['My other reason for coming here,', 'is that it is\njust as well to see a good man or two when one is possibly near to\ndeath.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
You are right, Has anyone
seen about the horses?
subQuotationList: ['You are right,', 'Has anyone\nseen about the horses?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Yes, you may be quite certain that I gave orders
the moment I came in. Those enemies of yours gave no impression of
hurry, but they were really moving wonderfully fast, like a
well-trained army. I had no idea that the anarchists had so much
discipline. You have not a moment to waste.
subQuotationList:
['Yes,', 'you may be quite certain that I gave orders
the moment I came in. Those enemies of yours gave no impression of
hurry, but they were really moving wonderfully fast, like a
well-trained army. I had no idea that the anarchists had so much
discipline. You have not a moment to waste.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
Four out of the five rich men in this town, are common
swindlers. I suppose the proportion is pretty equal all over the world.
The fifth is a friend of mine, and a very fine fellow; and what is even
more important from our point of view, he owns a motor-car.
subQuotationList:
['Four out of the five rich men in this town,', 'are common
swindlers. I suppose the proportion is pretty equal all over the world.
The fifth is a friend of mine, and a very fine fellow; and what is even
more important from our point of view, he owns a motor-car.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: I am afraid, I am afraid we have hardly time for afternoon calls.
subQuotationList: ['I am afraid,', 'I am afraid we have hardly time for afternoon calls.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Doctor Renard's house is only three minutes off,
subQuotationList: ["Doctor Renard's house is only three minutes off,"]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: Our danger, is not two minutes off.
subQuotationList: ['Our danger,', 'is not two minutes off.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
Yes, if we ride on fast we must leave them behind, for
they are on foot.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', 'if we ride on fast we must leave them behind, for\nthey are on foot.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: He has a motor-car,
subQuotationList: ['He has a motor-car,']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: But we may not get it,
subQuotationList: ['But we may not get it,']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Yes, he is quite on your side.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, he is quite on your side.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: But he might be out.
subQuotationList: ['But he might be out.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Hold your tongue, What is that noise?
subQuotationList: ['Hold your tongue,', 'What is that noise?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
They have done us, Prepare to
receive cavalry!
subQuotationList: ['They have done us,', 'Prepare to\nreceive cavalry!']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], []]

quoteText: Where can they have got the horses?
subQuotationList: ['Where can they have got the horses?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I was speaking with strict accuracy when I said that the 'Soleil d'Or'
was the only place where one can get horses within twenty miles.
subQuotationList: ["I was speaking with strict accuracy when I said that the 'Soleil d'Or'\nwas the only place where one can get horses within twenty miles."]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
No! I don't believe he'd do it. Not with all
that white hair.
subQuotationList: ['No!', "I don't believe he'd do it. Not with all\nthat white hair."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
He may have been forced, They must be at
least a hundred strong, for which reason we are all going to see my
friend Renard, who has a motor-car.
subQuotationList: ['He may have been forced,', 'They must be at\nleast a hundred strong, for which reason we are all going to see my\nfriend Renard, who has a motor-car.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Renard']]]

quoteText: Anarchy, it is childishness!
subQuotationList: ['Anarchy,', 'it is childishness!']
speaker: Dr. Renard
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: _Et  a_, and that is childishness, isn't it?
subQuotationList: ['_Et  a_,', "and that is childishness, isn't it?"]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Dr. Renard']

quoteText:
I am sorry to cut short a cultured
discussion, but can you lend me your motor-car now,
in two minutes?
subQuotationList: ['I am sorry to cut short a cultured\ndiscussion,', 'but can you lend me your motor-car now,\nin two minutes?']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Dr. Renard']

quoteText:
I have a suspicion that you are all mad, but God forbid that madness should in any way interrupt
friendship. Let us go round to the garage.
subQuotationList: ['I have a suspicion that you are all mad,', 'but God forbid that madness should in any way interrupt\nfriendship. Let us go round to the garage.']
speaker: Dr. Renard
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Dr. Renard']]]

quoteText: It is now or never, I hear horses.
subQuotationList: ['It is now or never,', 'I hear horses.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Dr. Renard']

quoteText: No, a horse.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'a horse.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: I am afraid it's no go.
subQuotationList: ["I am afraid it's no go."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Dr. Renard']
referringExpression: He bent his strength upon one handle and then said

quoteText: I can't understand why it has grown so dark,
subQuotationList: ["I can't understand why it has grown so dark,"]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Going to be a storm, I think, I say, it's a pity we
haven't got a light on this car, if only to see by.
subQuotationList: ['Going to be a storm, I think,', "I say, it's a pity we\nhaven't got a light on this car, if only to see by."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: We have,
subQuotationList: ['We have,']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Where on earth did you get that?
subQuotationList: ['Where on earth did you get that?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
I got it where I got the car, from
my best friend. While our friend here was fighting with the steering
wheel, I ran up the front steps of the house and spoke to Renard, who
was standing in his own porch, you will remember. I said, He looked up, blinking amiably at the
beautiful arched ceiling of his own front hall. From this was
suspended, by chains of exquisite ironwork, this lantern, one of the
hundred treasures of his treasure house. By sheer force he tore the
lamp out of his own ceiling, shattering the painted panels, and
bringing down two blue vases with his violence. Then he handed me the
iron lantern, and I put it in the car. Was I not right when I said that
Dr. Renard was worth knowing?
subQuotationList:
['I got it where I got the car,', 'from
my best friend. While our friend here was fighting with the steering
wheel, I ran up the front steps of the house and spoke to Renard, who
was standing in his own porch, you will remember.', 'I said,', 'He looked up, blinking amiably at the
beautiful arched ceiling of his own front hall. From this was
suspended, by chains of exquisite ironwork, this lantern, one of the
hundred treasures of his treasure house. By sheer force he tore the
lamp out of his own ceiling, shattering the painted panels, and
bringing down two blue vases with his violence. Then he handed me the
iron lantern, and I put it in the car. Was I not right when I said that
Dr. Renard was worth knowing?']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Renard'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms']], [], [['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard']]]

quoteText: You were,
subQuotationList: ['You were,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: These lights make one feel more cheerful.
subQuotationList: ['These lights make one feel more cheerful.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
There is only one set of lights that make me more cheerful, and they are those lights of the police station which I can see beyond
the town. Please God we may be there in ten minutes.
subQuotationList: ['There is only one set of lights that make me more cheerful,', 'and they are those lights of the police station which I can see beyond\nthe town. Please God we may be there in ten minutes.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Oh, this is all raving nonsense! If you really think that
ordinary people in ordinary houses are anarchists, you must be madder
than an anarchist yourself. If we turned and fought these fellows, the
whole town would fight for us.
subQuotationList:
['Oh, this is all raving nonsense!', 'If you really think that
ordinary people in ordinary houses are anarchists, you must be madder
than an anarchist yourself. If we turned and fought these fellows, the
whole town would fight for us.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
No, the whole town
would fight for them. We shall see.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'the whole town\nwould fight for them. We shall see.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: What is that noise?
subQuotationList: ['What is that noise?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Oh, the horses behind us, I suppose, I thought we
had got clear of them.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, the horses behind us, I suppose,', 'I thought we\nhad got clear of them.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
The horses behind us! No, it is not horses, and
it is not behind us.
subQuotationList: ['The horses behind us! No,', 'it is not horses, and\nit is not behind us.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
I tell you they were his, and they were
full of men in masks!
subQuotationList: ['I tell you they were his,', 'and they were\nfull of men in masks!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Absurd! Dr. Renard would never give them
his cars.
subQuotationList: ['Absurd!', 'Dr. Renard would never give them\nhis cars.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
He may have been forced, The whole town is
on their side.
subQuotationList: ['He may have been forced,', 'The whole town is\non their side.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: You still believe that,
subQuotationList: ['You still believe that,']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: You will all believe it soon,
subQuotationList: ['You will all believe it soon,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
No, I can't believe it. The thing is nonsense. The plain people of a
peaceable French town
subQuotationList: ["No, I can't believe it. The thing is nonsense. The plain people of a\npeaceable French town"]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText: My God! someone has shot at us.
subQuotationList: ['My God!', 'someone has shot at us.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
It need not interrupt conversation, Pray
resume your remarks, Colonel. You were talking, I think, about the
plain people of a peaceable French town.
subQuotationList: ['It need not interrupt conversation,', 'Pray\nresume your remarks, Colonel. You were talking, I think, about the\nplain people of a peaceable French town.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: It is extraordinary, most extraordinary.
subQuotationList: ['It is extraordinary,', 'most extraordinary.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
A fastidious person, might even call it unpleasant.
However, I suppose those lights out in the field beyond this street are
the Gendarmerie. We shall soon get there.
subQuotationList: ['A fastidious person,', 'might even call it unpleasant.\nHowever, I suppose those lights out in the field beyond this street are\nthe Gendarmerie. We shall soon get there.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: No, we shall never get there.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'we shall never get there.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: What do you mean?
subQuotationList: ['What do you mean?']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
I mean that we shall never get there, They have two rows of armed men across the road already; I can see
them from here. The town is in arms, as I said it was. I can only
wallow in the exquisite comfort of my own exactitude.
subQuotationList: ['I mean that we shall never get there,', 'They have two rows of armed men across the road already; I can see\nthem from here. The town is in arms, as I said it was. I can only\nwallow in the exquisite comfort of my own exactitude.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
It is quite true. There is a crowd or an army or some such thing
across the end of that street.
subQuotationList: ['It is quite true. There is a crowd or an army or some such thing\nacross the end of that street.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
referringExpression: Syme whose eyes were the keenest broke into a little bitter whistle and said

quoteText:
Well, if there is, it must be something
else a sham fight or the mayor's birthday or something. I cannot and
will not believe that plain, jolly people in a place like this walk
about with dynamite in their pockets. Get on a bit, Syme, and let us
look at them.
subQuotationList:
['Well, if there is,', "it must be something
else a sham fight or the mayor's birthday or something. I cannot and
will not believe that plain, jolly people in a place like this walk
about with dynamite in their pockets. Get on a bit, Syme, and let us
look at them."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Why, you silly mugs! what did I tell you. That crowd's as
law-abiding as a cow, and if it weren't, it's on our side.
subQuotationList: ['Why, you silly mugs!', "what did I tell you. That crowd's as\nlaw-abiding as a cow, and if it weren't, it's on our side."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Bull', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor']]]

quoteText: How do you know?
subQuotationList: ['How do you know?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: You blind bat, don't you see who is leading them?
subQuotationList: ['You blind bat,', "don't you see who is leading them?"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Why, it's Renard!
subQuotationList: ["Why, it's Renard!"]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
referringExpression: the Colonel with a catch in his voice cried out

quoteText:
What a fool I've been! Of course, the dear
old boy has turned out to help us.
subQuotationList: ["What a fool I've been!", 'Of course, the dear\nold boy has turned out to help us.']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Dr. Renard! Dr. Renard!
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Renard! Dr. Renard!']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Dr. Renard']
referringExpression: He jumped out of the car and ran across the intervening space calling out

quoteText: Well, what do you think now?
subQuotationList: ['Well,', 'what do you think now?']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
I think, that I am lying in bed at No.
217 Peabody Buildings, and that I shall soon wake up with a jump; or,
if that's not it, I think that I am sitting in a small cushioned cell
in Hanwell, and that the doctor can't make much of my case. But if you
want to know what I don't think, I'll tell you. I don't think what you
think. I don't think, and I never shall think, that the mass of
ordinary men are a pack of dirty modern thinkers. No, sir, I'm a
democrat, and I still don't believe that Sunday could convert one
average navvy or counter-jumper. No, I may be mad, but humanity isn't.
subQuotationList:
['I think,', "that I am lying in bed at No.
217 Peabody Buildings, and that I shall soon wake up with a jump; or,
if that's not it, I think that I am sitting in a small cushioned cell
in Hanwell, and that the doctor can't make much of my case. But if you
want to know what I don't think, I'll tell you. I don't think what you
think. I don't think, and I never shall think, that the mass of
ordinary men are a pack of dirty modern thinkers. No, sir, I'm a
democrat, and I still don't believe that Sunday could convert one
average navvy or counter-jumper. No, I may be mad, but humanity isn't."]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
You are a very fine fellow, You can believe in a sanity
which is not merely your sanity. And you're right enough about
humanity, about peasants and people like that jolly old innkeeper. But
you're not right about Renard. I suspected him from the first. He's
rationalistic, and, what's worse, he's rich. When duty and religion are
really destroyed, it will be by the rich.
subQuotationList:
['You are a very fine fellow,', "You can believe in a sanity
which is not merely your sanity. And you're right enough about
humanity, about peasants and people like that jolly old innkeeper. But
you're not right about Renard. I suspected him from the first. He's
rationalistic, and, what's worse, he's rich. When duty and religion are
really destroyed, it will be by the rich."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Bull']], [['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Dr. Renard']]]

quoteText: They are really destroyed now, The devils are coming on!
subQuotationList: ['They are really destroyed now,', 'The devils are coming on!']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
referringExpression: said the man with a cigarette

quoteText:
Gentlemen, the thing is incredible. It must be a practical
joke. If you knew Renard as I do it's like calling Queen Victoria a
dynamiter. If you had got the man's character into your head
subQuotationList: ['Gentlemen,', "the thing is incredible. It must be a practical\njoke. If you knew Renard as I do it's like calling Queen Victoria a\ndynamiter. If you had got the man's character into your head"]
speaker: Colonel Ducroix
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Dr. Bull, has at least got it into his hat.
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Bull,', 'has at least got it into his hat.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: I tell you it can't be! Renard shall explain it. He shall explain it to me,
subQuotationList: ["I tell you it can't be!", 'Renard shall explain it. He shall explain it to me,']
speaker: Colonel Ducroix

quoteText:
Don't be in such a hurry, He will very soon
explain it to all of us.
subQuotationList: ["Don't be in such a hurry,", 'He will very soon\nexplain it to all of us.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
It is no good, He will never get anything out of that old
heathen. I vote we drive bang through the thick of them, bang as the
bullets went through Bull's hat. We may all be killed, but we must kill
a tidy number of them.
subQuotationList:
['It is no good,', "He will never get anything out of that old
heathen. I vote we drive bang through the thick of them, bang as the
bullets went through Bull's hat. We may all be killed, but we must kill
a tidy number of them."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Secretary', 'Dr. Renard'], ['Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Secretary', 'Dr. Renard']]]

quoteText:
I won't 'ave it, The poor chaps may be making a mistake. Give the
Colonel a chance.
subQuotationList: ["I won't 'ave it,", 'The poor chaps may be making a mistake. Give the\nColonel a chance.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Shall we go back, then?
subQuotationList: ['Shall we go back, then?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
No, the street behind us is held
too. In fact, I seem to see there another friend of yours, Syme.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'the street behind us is held\ntoo. In fact, I seem to see there another friend of yours, Syme.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: What the devil is up?
subQuotationList: ['What the devil is up?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: The morning star has fallen!
subQuotationList: ['The morning star has fallen!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: The world is insane!
subQuotationList: ['The world is insane!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: No, it is I.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'it is I.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: What are we going to do?
subQuotationList: ['What are we going to do?']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
At this moment, I think we
are going to smash into a lamppost.
subQuotationList: ['At this moment,', 'I think we\nare going to smash into a lamppost.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Well, we smashed something, That's some comfort.
subQuotationList: ['Well, we smashed something,', "That's some comfort."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: You're becoming an anarchist,
subQuotationList: ["You're becoming an anarchist,"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Everyone is,
subQuotationList: ['Everyone is,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
We have one more chance, Whatever all this pandemonium means, I suppose the police
station will help us. We can't get there, for they hold the way. But
there's a pier or breakwater runs out into the sea just here, which we
could defend longer than anything else, like Horatius and his bridge.
We must defend it till the Gendarmerie turn out. Keep after me.
subQuotationList:
['We have one more chance,', "Whatever all this pandemonium means, I suppose the police
station will help us. We can't get there, for they hold the way. But
there's a pier or breakwater runs out into the sea just here, which we
could defend longer than anything else, like Horatius and his bridge.
We must defend it till the Gendarmerie turn out. Keep after me."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Secretary', 'Dr. Renard'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: The peasant! They have not risen since the Middle Ages.
subQuotationList: ['The peasant!', 'They have not risen since the Middle Ages.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Even if the police do come now, they
can do nothing with this mob.
subQuotationList: ['Even if the police do come now,', 'they\ncan do nothing with this mob.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Nonsense! there must be some people left in
the town who are human.
subQuotationList: ['Nonsense!', 'there must be some people left in\nthe town who are human.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
No, the human being will soon be
extinct. We are the last of mankind.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'the human being will soon be\nextinct. We are the last of mankind.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: It may be,
subQuotationList: ['It may be,']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: What is all that at the end of the 'Dunciad'?
subQuotationList: ["What is all that at the end of the 'Dunciad'?"]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Stop! the gendarmes are out. They are charging the mob!
subQuotationList: ['Stop!', 'the gendarmes are out.', 'They are charging the mob!']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: No, they are formed along the parade.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'they are formed along the parade.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: They have unslung their carbines,
subQuotationList: ['They have unslung their carbines,']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Yes, and they are going to fire on us.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', 'and they are going to fire on us.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The Secretary'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: The gendarmes have joined them!
subQuotationList: ['The gendarmes have joined them!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: I am in the padded cell,
subQuotationList: ['I am in the padded cell,']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
What does it matter who is mad or who is sane? We shall all be dead
soon.
subQuotationList: ['What does it matter who is mad or who is sane? We shall all be dead\nsoon.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: You are quite hopeless, then?
subQuotationList: ['You are quite hopeless, then?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
referringExpression: Syme turned to him and said

quoteText:
No; oddly enough I am not quite hopeless. There is one insane little
hope that I cannot get out of my mind. The power of this whole planet
is against us, yet I cannot help wondering whether this one silly
little hope is hopeless yet.
subQuotationList:
['No; oddly enough I am not quite hopeless. There is one insane little
hope that I cannot get out of my mind. The power of this whole planet
is against us, yet I cannot help wondering whether this one silly
little hope is hopeless yet.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText: In what or whom is your hope?
subQuotationList: ['In what or whom is your hope?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: In a man I never saw,
subQuotationList: ['In a man I never saw,']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
I know what you mean, the man in the dark
room. But Sunday must have killed him by now.
subQuotationList: ['I know what you mean,', 'the man in the dark\nroom. But Sunday must have killed him by now.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Inspector Ratcliffe']], [['The Invisible Chief'], ['The President'], ['The Invisible Chief']]]

quoteText:
Perhaps, but if so, he was the only man
whom Sunday found it hard to kill.
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps,', 'but if so, he was the only man\nwhom Sunday found it hard to kill.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
I heard what you said, I
also am holding hard on to the thing I never saw.
subQuotationList: ['I heard what you said,', 'I\nalso am holding hard on to the thing I never saw.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Where is the Colonel? I thought he was with us!
subQuotationList: ['Where is the Colonel? I thought he was with us!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
referringExpression: Syme who was standing as if blind with introspective thought swung round and cried out
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Colonel Ducroix'], ['Colonel Ducroix'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: The Colonel! Yes, where on earth is the Colonel?
subQuotationList: ['The Colonel! Yes,', 'where on earth is the Colonel?']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: He went to speak to Renard,
subQuotationList: ['He went to speak to Renard,']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
We cannot leave him among all those beasts, Let us die
like gentlemen if
subQuotationList: ['We cannot leave him among all those beasts,', 'Let us die\nlike gentlemen if']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Colonel Ducroix']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Do not pity the Colonel, He is
extremely comfortable. He is
subQuotationList: ['Do not pity the Colonel,', 'He is\nextremely comfortable. He is']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
No! no! no! not the Colonel too! I
will never believe it!
subQuotationList: ['No! no! no!', 'not the Colonel too! I\nwill never believe it!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Will you believe your eyes?
subQuotationList: ['Will you believe your eyes?']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe

quoteText:
Yes, he is gone too, Everything's gone. I'm gone! I can't trust my own bodily machinery. I
feel as if my own hand might fly up and strike me.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, he is gone too,', "Everything's gone. I'm gone! I can't trust my own bodily machinery. I\nfeel as if my own hand might fly up and strike me."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: When my hand flies up, it will strike somebody else,
subQuotationList: ['When my hand flies up,', 'it will strike somebody else,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Judas before Herod!
subQuotationList: ['Judas before Herod!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Do you see this lantern? Do you see
the cross carved on it, and the flame inside? You did not make it. You
did not light it. Better men than you, men who could believe and obey,
twisted the entrails of iron and preserved the legend of fire. There is
not a street you walk on, there is not a thread you wear, that was not
made as this lantern was, by denying your philosophy of dirt and rats.
You can make nothing. You can only destroy. You will destroy mankind;
you will destroy the world. Let that suffice you. Yet this one old
Christian lantern you shall not destroy. It shall go where your empire
of apes will never have the wit to find it.
subQuotationList:
['Do you see this lantern?', 'Do you see
the cross carved on it, and the flame inside? You did not make it. You
did not light it. Better men than you, men who could believe and obey,
twisted the entrails of iron and preserved the legend of fire. There is
not a street you walk on, there is not a thread you wear, that was not
made as this lantern was, by denying your philosophy of dirt and rats.
You can make nothing. You can only destroy. You will destroy mankind;
you will destroy the world. Let that suffice you. Yet this one old
Christian lantern you shall not destroy. It shall go where your empire
of apes will never have the wit to find it.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Secretary']], [['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary']]]

quoteText: Swords! Let us charge these dogs, for our time has come to die.
subQuotationList: ['Swords!', 'Let us charge these dogs, for our time has come to die.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The Secretary', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Dr. Renard'], ['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Professor', 'Inspector Ratcliffe']]]

quoteText:
There is some mistake, Mr. Syme, I hardly think you
understand your position. I arrest you in the name of the law.
subQuotationList: ['There is some mistake,', 'Mr. Syme, I hardly think you\nunderstand your position. I arrest you in the name of the law.']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: Of the law?
subQuotationList: ['Of the law?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Colonel Ducroix', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull']

quoteText: Certainly! I am a detective from Scotland Yard,
subQuotationList: ['Certainly!', 'I am a detective from Scotland Yard,']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: And what do you suppose we are?
subQuotationList: ['And what do you suppose we are?']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Secretary'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
You, are, as I know for a fact, members
of the Supreme Anarchist Council. Disguised as one of you, I
subQuotationList: ['You,', 'are, as I know for a fact, members\nof the Supreme Anarchist Council. Disguised as one of you, I']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
There never was any Supreme Anarchist Council, We were all
a lot of silly policemen looking at each other. And all these nice
people who have been peppering us with shot thought we were the
dynamiters. I knew I couldn't be wrong about the mob, Vulgar people are never mad. I'm vulgar myself, and I
know. I am now going on shore to stand a drink to everybody here.
subQuotationList:
['There never was any Supreme Anarchist Council,', "We were all
a lot of silly policemen looking at each other. And all these nice
people who have been peppering us with shot thought we were the
dynamiters. I knew I couldn't be wrong about the mob,", "Vulgar people are never mad. I'm vulgar myself, and I
know. I am now going on shore to stand a drink to everybody here."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Colonel Ducroix', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], []]

quoteText:
I can't make head or tail of old Sunday's little game any more than
you can, But whatever else Sunday is, he isn't a blameless
citizen. Damn it! do you remember his face?
subQuotationList: ["I can't make head or tail of old Sunday's little game any more than\nyou can,", "But whatever else Sunday is, he isn't a blameless\ncitizen. Damn it! do you remember his face?"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme']], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
I grant you, that I have never been able to forget
it.
subQuotationList: ['I grant you,', 'that I have never been able to forget\nit.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Well,
subQuotationList: ['Well,']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText:
I suppose we can find out soon, for
tomorrow we have our next general meeting. You will excuse me, for being well acquainted with my
secretarial duties.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose we can find out soon, for\ntomorrow we have our next general meeting. You will excuse me,', 'for being well acquainted with my\nsecretarial duties.']
speaker: The Secretary
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme']], []]

quoteText:
I suppose you are right, I suppose
we might find it out from him; but I confess that I should feel a bit
afraid of asking Sunday who he really is.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose you are right,', 'I suppose\nwe might find it out from him; but I confess that I should feel a bit\nafraid of asking Sunday who he really is.']
speaker: Professor De Worms
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Secretary']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President']]]

quoteText: Why, for fear of bombs?
subQuotationList: ['Why,', 'for fear of bombs?']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText: No, for fear he might tell me.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'for fear he might tell me.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: Let us have some drinks,
subQuotationList: ['Let us have some drinks,']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: I tell you I've seen him!
subQuotationList: ["I tell you I've seen him!"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Whom? Not the President?
subQuotationList: ['Whom?', 'Not the President?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Not so bad as that, not so
bad as that. I've got him here.
subQuotationList: ['Not so bad as that,', "not so\nbad as that. I've got him here."]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Got whom here?
subQuotationList: ['Got whom here?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Hairy man, man that used to be hairy
man Gogol. Here he is,
subQuotationList: ['Hairy man,', 'man that used to be hairy\nman Gogol. Here he is,']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Why do you worry with me? You have expelled me as a spy.
subQuotationList: ['Why do you worry with me?', 'You have expelled me as a spy.']
speaker: Gogol

quoteText: We are all spies!
subQuotationList: ['We are all spies!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: We're all spies! Come and have a drink.
subQuotationList: ["We're all spies!", 'Come and have a drink.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], []]

quoteText:
This is more cheerful, we are six men going to ask
one man what he means.
subQuotationList: ['This is more cheerful,', 'we are six men going to ask\none man what he means.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
I think it is a bit queerer than that, I think it is six
men going to ask one man what they mean. My reason is quite simple, I attack him rashly because I
am afraid of him.
subQuotationList: ['I think it is a bit queerer than that,', 'I think it is six\nmen going to ask one man what they mean.', 'My reason is quite simple,', 'I attack him rashly because I\nam afraid of him.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor', 'The Secretary']], [], [['The President'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
Delightful! So pleased to see you all. What an exquisite
day it is. Is the Czar dead?
subQuotationList: ['Delightful!', 'So pleased to see you all. What an exquisite\nday it is. Is the Czar dead?']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
No, sir, there has been no massacre. I bring you
news of no such disgusting spectacles.
subQuotationList: ['No, sir,', 'there has been no massacre. I bring you\nnews of no such disgusting spectacles.']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: Disgusting spectacles? You mean Dr. Bull's spectacles?
subQuotationList: ['Disgusting spectacles?', "You mean Dr. Bull's spectacles?"]
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
Of course, we all have our opinions and even our eyes, but really to
call them disgusting before the man himself
subQuotationList: ['Of course, we all have our opinions and even our eyes, but really to\ncall them disgusting before the man himself']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Gabriel Syme', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor', 'The Secretary', 'The President'], ['Gabriel Syme', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor', 'The Secretary', 'The President'], ['Gabriel Syme', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Professor', 'The Secretary', 'The President'], ['Bull']]]

quoteText:
My spectacles are blackguardly, but I'm not. Look at my
face.
subQuotationList: ['My spectacles are blackguardly,', "but I'm not. Look at my\nface."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
I dare say it's the sort of face that grows on one, in fact, it grows on you; and who am I to quarrel with the
wild fruits upon the Tree of Life? I dare say it will grow on me some
day.
subQuotationList: ["I dare say it's the sort of face that grows on one,", 'in fact, it grows on you; and who am I to quarrel with the\nwild fruits upon the Tree of Life? I dare say it will grow on me some\nday.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
We have no time for tomfoolery, We have come to know what all this means. Who are you? What
are you? Why did you get us all here? Do you know who and what we are?
Are you a half-witted man playing the conspirator, or are you a clever
man playing the fool? Answer me, I tell you.
subQuotationList:
['We have no time for tomfoolery,', 'We have come to know what all this means. Who are you? What
are you? Why did you get us all here? Do you know who and what we are?
Are you a half-witted man playing the conspirator, or are you a clever
man playing the fool? Answer me, I tell you.']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
Candidates, are only required to answer eight out
of the seventeen questions on the paper. As far as I can make out, you
want me to tell you what I am, and what you are, and what this table
is, and what this Council is, and what this world is for all I know.
Well, I will go so far as to rend the veil of one mystery. If you want
to know what you are, you are a set of highly well-intentioned young
jackasses.
subQuotationList:
['Candidates,', 'are only required to answer eight out
of the seventeen questions on the paper. As far as I can make out, you
want me to tell you what I am, and what you are, and what this table
is, and what this Council is, and what this world is for all I know.
Well, I will go so far as to rend the veil of one mystery. If you want
to know what you are, you are a set of highly well-intentioned young
jackasses.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['The Secretary'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: And you, what are you?
subQuotationList: ['And you,', 'what are you?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'The President']

quoteText:
I? What am I? You want to know what I am, do you? Bull, you are a man of
science. Grub in the roots of those trees and find out the truth about
them. Syme, you are a poet. Stare at those morning clouds. But I tell
you this, that you will have found out the truth of the last tree and
the top-most cloud before the truth about me. You will understand the
sea, and I shall be still a riddle; you shall know what the stars are,
and not know what I am. Since the beginning of the world all men have
hunted me like a wolf kings and sages, and poets and lawgivers, all the
churches, and all the philosophies. But I have never been caught yet,
and the skies will fall in the time I turn to bay. I have given them a
good run for their money, and I will now.
subQuotationList:
['I? What am I?', 'You want to know what I am, do you? Bull, you are a man of
science. Grub in the roots of those trees and find out the truth about
them. Syme, you are a poet. Stare at those morning clouds. But I tell
you this, that you will have found out the truth of the last tree and
the top-most cloud before the truth about me. You will understand the
sea, and I shall be still a riddle; you shall know what the stars are,
and not know what I am. Since the beginning of the world all men have
hunted me like a wolf kings and sages, and poets and lawgivers, all the
churches, and all the philosophies. But I have never been caught yet,
and the skies will fall in the time I turn to bay. I have given them a
good run for their money, and I will now.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
There's one thing I'll tell you though about who I am. I am the man in
the dark room, who made you all policemen.
subQuotationList: ["There's one thing I'll tell you though about who I am. I am the man in\nthe dark room, who made you all policemen."]
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
referringExpression: he pulled himself up again as on a horizontal bar and thrusting his great chin over the edge of the balcony said
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Stop thief!
subQuotationList: ['Stop thief!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
referringExpression: he stood up in his own cab shouting

quoteText: What does the old maniac mean? What does yours say, Syme?
subQuotationList: ['What does the old maniac mean?', 'What does yours say, Syme?']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
After him! He can't go astray now. There's no mistaking
a fire-engine.
subQuotationList: ['After him!', "He can't go astray now. There's no mistaking\na fire-engine."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
What place can this be? Can it be the old devil's house?
I've heard he has a house in North London.
subQuotationList: ['What place can this be?', "Can it be the old devil's house?\nI've heard he has a house in North London."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: All the better, we shall find him at home.
subQuotationList: ['All the better,', 'we shall find him at home.']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
No, but it isn't that, I hear the
most horrible noises, like devils laughing and sneezing and blowing
their devilish noses!
subQuotationList: ["No, but it isn't that,", 'I hear the\nmost horrible noises, like devils laughing and sneezing and blowing\ntheir devilish noses!']

quoteText: His dogs barking, of course,

quoteText:
Why not say his black-beetles barking! snails
barking! geraniums barking! Did you ever hear a dog bark like that?

speaker: Gogol

quoteText: Well, listen to that, is that a dog anybody's dog?

quoteText:
Well, his house ought to be hell! and if it is
hell, I'm going in!

quoteText: Why, you asses, it's the Zoo!

The elephant! An elephant has gone mad and run

subQuotationList: ['The elephant!', 'An elephant has gone mad and run\naway!']

quoteText: A very large and fat old gentleman in light grey clothes,

quoteText:
Well, if he's that particular kind of old gentleman, if
you're quite sure that he's a large and fat old gentleman in grey
clothes, you may take my word for it that the elephant has not run away
with him. He has run away with the elephant. The elephant is not made
by God that could run away with him if he did not consent to the
elopement. And, by thunder, there he is!
subQuotationList:

quoteText: Stop a landslide! He is out of the gate!
subQuotationList: ['Stop a landslide!', 'He is out of the gate!']
speaker: The Keeper
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'A Man In Plain Clothes']

quoteText:
Great Lord! I never knew an elephant could go so fast.
Well, it must be hansom-cabs again if we are to keep him in sight.
subQuotationList: ['Great Lord!', 'I never knew an elephant could go so fast.\nWell, it must be hansom-cabs again if we are to keep him in sight.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'A Man In Plain Clothes', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The Keeper']

quoteText: Where has he gone to?
subQuotationList: ['Where has he gone to?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Gentleman rushed into the Exhibition, sir!
subQuotationList: ['Gentleman rushed into the Exhibition, sir!']
speaker: An Official
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
Funny gentleman, sir.
Asked me to hold his horse, and gave me this.
subQuotationList: ['Funny gentleman, sir.\nAsked me to hold his horse, and gave me this.']
speaker: An Official
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
Why the eternal crikey, did you let the man in?
Do people commonly come to your Exhibition riding on mad elephants?
Do
subQuotationList: ['Why the eternal crikey,', 'did you let the man in?\nDo people commonly come to your Exhibition riding on mad elephants?\nDo']

addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official', 'Gabriel Syme']

addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official', 'Gabriel Syme']

subQuotationList: ['Look at the captive balloon!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official']

subQuotationList: ['Why the blazes should I look at a captive balloon?', 'What is there queer about a captive balloon?']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: Nothing, except that it isn't captive!
subQuotationList: ['Nothing,', "except that it isn't captive!"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official']

quoteText: Ten thousand devils! He's got into it!
subQuotationList: ['Ten thousand devils!', "He's got into it!"]
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
God bless my soul! God
bless my soul! I seemed to fancy that something fell on the top of my
hat!
subQuotationList: ['God bless my soul!', 'God\nbless my soul! I seemed to fancy that something fell on the top of my\nhat!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
I'm not beaten yet. The blasted thing must come down somewhere. Let's
follow it!
subQuotationList: ["I'm not beaten yet. The blasted thing must come down somewhere. Let's\nfollow it!"]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'An Official']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: After all, it is very beautiful!
subQuotationList: ['After all,', 'it is very beautiful!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
It is singularly and strangely beautiful! I wish
the beastly gas-bag would burst!
subQuotationList: ['It is singularly and strangely beautiful!', 'I wish\nthe beastly gas-bag would burst!']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: No, I hope it won't. It might hurt the old boy.
subQuotationList: ['No,', "I hope it won't. It might hurt the old boy."]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
Hurt him! hurt him! Not as much as
I'd hurt him if I could get up with him. Little Snowdrop!
subQuotationList: ['Hurt him!', "hurt him! Not as much as\nI'd hurt him if I could get up with him. Little Snowdrop!"]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: I don't want him hurt, somehow,
subQuotationList: ["I don't want him hurt, somehow,"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
What! Do you believe all that tale
about his being our man in the dark room? Sunday would say he was
anybody.
subQuotationList: ['What!', 'Do you believe all that tale\nabout his being our man in the dark room? Sunday would say he was\nanybody.']
speaker: The Secretary
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President'], ['The President'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
I don't know whether I believe it or not, But it
isn't that that I mean. I can't wish old Sunday's balloon to burst
because
subQuotationList: ["I don't know whether I believe it or not,", "But it\nisn't that that I mean. I can't wish old Sunday's balloon to burst\nbecause"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: Well, because?
subQuotationList: ['Well,', 'because?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Well, because he's so jolly like a balloon himself, I don't understand a word of all that idea of his being
the same man who gave us all our blue cards. It seems to make
everything nonsense. But I don't care who knows it, I always had a
sympathy for old Sunday himself, wicked as he was. Just as if he was a
great bouncing baby. How can I explain what my queer sympathy was? It
didn't prevent my fighting him like hell! Shall I make it clear if I
say that I liked him because he was so fat?
subQuotationList:
["Well, because he's so jolly like a balloon himself,", "I don't understand a word of all that idea of his being
the same man who gave us all our blue cards. It seems to make
everything nonsense. But I don't care who knows it, I always had a
sympathy for old Sunday himself, wicked as he was. Just as if he was a
great bouncing baby. How can I explain what my queer sympathy was? It
didn't prevent my fighting him like hell! Shall I make it clear if I
say that I liked him because he was so fat?"]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President']], [['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President']]]

quoteText: You will not,
subQuotationList: ['You will not,']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText:
I've got it now, it was because he was so fat and so
light. Just like a balloon. We always think of fat people as heavy, but
he could have danced against a sylph. I see now what I mean. Moderate
strength is shown in violence, supreme strength is shown in levity. It
was like the old speculations what would happen if an elephant could
leap up in the sky like a grasshopper?
subQuotationList:
["I've got it now,", 'it was because he was so fat and so
light. Just like a balloon. We always think of fat people as heavy, but
he could have danced against a sylph. I see now what I mean. Moderate
strength is shown in violence, supreme strength is shown in levity. It
was like the old speculations what would happen if an elephant could
leap up in the sky like a grasshopper?']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
Our elephant, has leapt into the sky
like a grasshopper.
subQuotationList: ['Our elephant,', 'has leapt into the sky\nlike a grasshopper.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
And somehow, that's why I can't help liking old
Sunday. No, it's not an admiration of force, or any silly thing like
that. There is a kind of gaiety in the thing, as if he were bursting
with some good news. Haven't you sometimes felt it on a spring day? You
know Nature plays tricks, but somehow that day proves they are
good-natured tricks. I never read the Bible myself, but that part they
laugh at is literal truth, The hills do
leap at least, they try to.... Why do I like Sunday?... how can I tell
you?... because he's such a Bounder.
subQuotationList:
['And somehow,', "that's why I can't help liking old
Sunday. No, it's not an admiration of force, or any silly thing like
that. There is a kind of gaiety in the thing, as if he were bursting
with some good news. Haven't you sometimes felt it on a spring day? You
know Nature plays tricks, but somehow that day proves they are
good-natured tricks. I never read the Bible myself, but that part they
laugh at is literal truth,", "The hills do
leap at least, they try to.... Why do I like Sunday?... how can I tell
you?... because he's such a Bounder."]
speaker: Dr. Bull
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme']], [['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
You do not know Sunday at all. Perhaps it is because you are better
than I, and do not know hell. I was a fierce fellow, and a trifle
morbid from the first. The man who sits in darkness, and who chose us
all, chose me because I had all the crazy look of a conspirator because
my smile went crooked, and my eyes were gloomy, even when I smiled. But
there must have been something in me that answered to the nerves in all
these anarchic men. For when I first saw Sunday he expressed to me, not
your airy vitality, but something both gross and sad in the Nature of
Things. I found him smoking in a twilight room, a room with brown blind
down, infinitely more depressing than the genial darkness in which our
master lives. He sat there on a bench, a huge heap of a man, dark and
out of shape. He listened to all my words without speaking or even
stirring. I poured out my most passionate appeals, and asked my most
eloquent questions. Then, after a long silence, the Thing began to
shake, and I thought it was shaken by some secret malady. It shook like
a loathsome and living jelly. It reminded me of everything I had ever
read about the base bodies that are the origin of life the deep sea
lumps and protoplasm. It seemed like the final form of matter, the most
shapeless and the most shameful. I could only tell myself, from its
shudderings, that it was something at least that such a monster could
be miserable. And then it broke upon me that the bestial mountain was
shaking with a lonely laughter, and the laughter was at me. Do you ask
me to forgive him that? It is no small thing to be laughed at by
something at once lower and stronger than oneself.
subQuotationList:
['You do not know Sunday at all. Perhaps it is because you are better
than I, and do not know hell. I was a fierce fellow, and a trifle
morbid from the first. The man who sits in darkness, and who chose us
all, chose me because I had all the crazy look of a conspirator because
my smile went crooked, and my eyes were gloomy, even when I smiled. But
there must have been something in me that answered to the nerves in all
these anarchic men. For when I first saw Sunday he expressed to me, not
your airy vitality, but something both gross and sad in the Nature of
Things. I found him smoking in a twilight room, a room with brown blind
down, infinitely more depressing than the genial darkness in which our
master lives. He sat there on a bench, a huge heap of a man, dark and
out of shape. He listened to all my words without speaking or even
stirring. I poured out my most passionate appeals, and asked my most
eloquent questions. Then, after a long silence, the Thing began to
shake, and I thought it was shaken by some secret malady. It shook like
a loathsome and living jelly. It reminded me of everything I had ever
read about the base bodies that are the origin of life the deep sea
lumps and protoplasm. It seemed like the final form of matter, the most
shapeless and the most shameful. I could only tell myself, from its
shudderings, that it was something at least that such a monster could
be miserable. And then it broke upon me that the bestial mountain was
