something at once lower and stronger than oneself.']
speaker: The Secretary
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
Surely you fellows are exaggerating wildly, President Sunday is a terrible fellow for one's
intellect, but he is not such a Barnum's freak physically as you make
out. He received me in an ordinary office, in a grey check coat, in
broad daylight. He talked to me in an ordinary way. But I'll tell you
what is a trifle creepy about Sunday. His room is neat, his clothes are
neat, everything seems in order; but he's absent-minded. Sometimes his
great bright eyes go quite blind. For hours he forgets that you are
there. Now absent-mindedness is just a bit too awful in a bad man. We
think of a wicked man as vigilant. We can't think of a wicked man who
is honestly and sincerely dreamy, because we daren't think of a wicked
man alone with himself. An absentminded man means a good-natured man.
It means a man who, if he happens to see you, will apologise. But how
will you bear an absentminded man who, if he happens to see you, will
kill you? That is what tries the nerves, abstraction combined with
cruelty. Men have felt it sometimes when they went through wild
forests, and felt that the animals there were at once innocent and
pitiless. They might ignore or slay. How would you like to pass ten
mortal hours in a parlour with an absent-minded tiger?
subQuotationList:
['Surely you fellows are exaggerating wildly,', "President Sunday is a terrible fellow for one's
intellect, but he is not such a Barnum's freak physically as you make
out. He received me in an ordinary office, in a grey check coat, in
broad daylight. He talked to me in an ordinary way. But I'll tell you
what is a trifle creepy about Sunday. His room is neat, his clothes are
neat, everything seems in order; but he's absent-minded. Sometimes his
great bright eyes go quite blind. For hours he forgets that you are
there. Now absent-mindedness is just a bit too awful in a bad man. We
think of a wicked man as vigilant. We can't think of a wicked man who
is honestly and sincerely dreamy, because we daren't think of a wicked
man alone with himself. An absentminded man means a good-natured man.
It means a man who, if he happens to see you, will apologise. But how
will you bear an absentminded man who, if he happens to see you, will
kill you? That is what tries the nerves, abstraction combined with
cruelty. Men have felt it sometimes when they went through wild
forests, and felt that the animals there were at once innocent and
pitiless. They might ignore or slay. How would you like to pass ten
mortal hours in a parlour with an absent-minded tiger?"]
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
referringExpression: cut in the clear voice of Inspector Ratcliffe
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary']], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary']]]

quoteText: And what do you think of Sunday, Gogol?
subQuotationList: ['And what do you think of Sunday, Gogol?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
I don't think of Sunday on principle, any more
than I stare at the sun at noonday.
subQuotationList: ["I don't think of Sunday on principle,", 'any more\nthan I stare at the sun at noonday.']
speaker: Gogol
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
Well, that is a point of view, What do you
say, Professor? Wake up, Professor! Tell us what you think of
Sunday.
subQuotationList: ['Well, that is a point of view,', 'What do you\nsay, Professor?', 'Wake up, Professor!', 'Tell us what you think of\nSunday.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms'], ['Professor De Worms']], [['Professor De Worms']], [['Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
I think something, that I cannot say clearly. Or, rather, I
think something that I cannot even think clearly. But it is something
like this. My early life, as you know, was a bit too large and loose. Well, when I saw Sunday's face I thought it was too large everybody
does, but I also thought it was too loose. The face was so big, that
one couldn't focus it or make it a face at all. The eye was so far away
from the nose, that it wasn't an eye. The mouth was so much by itself,
that one had to think of it by itself. The whole thing is too hard to
explain.
subQuotationList:
['I think something,', 'that I cannot say clearly. Or, rather, I
think something that I cannot even think clearly. But it is something
like this. My early life, as you know, was a bit too large and loose.', "Well, when I saw Sunday's face I thought it was too large everybody
does, but I also thought it was too loose. The face was so big, that
one couldn't focus it or make it a face at all. The eye was so far away
from the nose, that it wasn't an eye. The mouth was so much by itself,
that one had to think of it by itself. The whole thing is too hard to
explain."]
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
But put it this way. Walking up a road at night, I have seen a lamp
and a lighted window and a cloud make together a most complete and
unmistakable face. If anyone in heaven has that face I shall know him
again. Yet when I walked a little farther I found that there was no
face, that the window was ten yards away, the lamp ten hundred yards,
the cloud beyond the world. Well, Sunday's face escaped me; it ran away
to right and left, as such chance pictures run away. And so his face
has made me, somehow, doubt whether there are any faces. I don't know
whether your face, Bull, is a face or a combination in perspective.
Perhaps one black disc of your beastly glasses is quite close and
another fifty miles away. Oh, the doubts of a materialist are not worth
a dump. Sunday has taught me the last and the worst doubts, the doubts
of a spiritualist. I am a Buddhist, I suppose; and Buddhism is not a
creed, it is a doubt. My poor dear Bull, I do not believe that you
really have a face. I have not faith enough to believe in matter.
subQuotationList:
["But put it this way. Walking up a road at night, I have seen a lamp
and a lighted window and a cloud make together a most complete and
unmistakable face. If anyone in heaven has that face I shall know him
again. Yet when I walked a little farther I found that there was no
face, that the window was ten yards away, the lamp ten hundred yards,
the cloud beyond the world. Well, Sunday's face escaped me; it ran away
to right and left, as such chance pictures run away. And so his face
has made me, somehow, doubt whether there are any faces. I don't know
whether your face, Bull, is a face or a combination in perspective.
Perhaps one black disc of your beastly glasses is quite close and
another fifty miles away. Oh, the doubts of a materialist are not worth
a dump. Sunday has taught me the last and the worst doubts, the doubts
of a spiritualist. I am a Buddhist, I suppose; and Buddhism is not a
creed, it is a doubt. My poor dear Bull, I do not believe that you
really have a face. I have not faith enough to believe in matter."]
speaker: Professor De Worms
referringExpression: He paused for a little still trailing his stick and then went on
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['Dr. Bull']]]

quoteText:
Have you noticed an odd thing, about all your descriptions?
Each man of you finds Sunday quite different, yet each man of you can
only find one thing to compare him to the universe itself. Bull finds
him like the earth in spring, Gogol like the sun at noonday. The
Secretary is reminded of the shapeless protoplasm, and the Inspector of
the carelessness of virgin forests. The Professor says he is like a
changing landscape. This is queer, but it is queerer still that I also
have had my odd notion about the President, and I also find that I
think of Sunday as I think of the whole world.
subQuotationList:
['Have you noticed an odd thing,', 'about all your descriptions?
Each man of you finds Sunday quite different, yet each man of you can
only find one thing to compare him to the universe itself. Bull finds
him like the earth in spring, Gogol like the sun at noonday. The
Secretary is reminded of the shapeless protoplasm, and the Inspector of
the carelessness of virgin forests. The Professor says he is like a
changing landscape. This is queer, but it is queerer still that I also
have had my odd notion about the President, and I also find that I
think of Sunday as I think of the whole world.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['Dr. Bull'], ['The President'], ['Gogol'], ['Professor De Worms']]]

quoteText: Get on a little faster, Syme, never mind the balloon.
subQuotationList: ['Get on a little faster, Syme,', 'never mind the balloon.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
When I first saw Sunday, I only saw his back; and
when I saw his back, I knew he was the worst man in the world. His neck
and shoulders were brutal, like those of some apish god. His head had a
stoop that was hardly human, like the stoop of an ox. In fact, I had at
once the revolting fancy that this was not a man at all, but a beast
dressed up in men's clothes.
subQuotationList:
['When I first saw Sunday,', "I only saw his back; and
when I saw his back, I knew he was the worst man in the world. His neck
and shoulders were brutal, like those of some apish god. His head had a
stoop that was hardly human, like the stoop of an ox. In fact, I had at
once the revolting fancy that this was not a man at all, but a beast
dressed up in men's clothes."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President']], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President']]]

quoteText: Get on,
subQuotationList: ['Get on,']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
And then the queer thing happened. I had seen his back from the
street, as he sat in the balcony. Then I entered the hotel, and coming
round the other side of him, saw his face in the sunlight. His face
frightened me, as it did everyone; but not because it was brutal, not
because it was evil. On the contrary, it frightened me because it was
so beautiful, because it was so good.
subQuotationList:
['And then the queer thing happened. I had seen his back from the
street, as he sat in the balcony. Then I entered the hotel, and coming
round the other side of him, saw his face in the sunlight. His face
frightened me, as it did everyone; but not because it was brutal, not
because it was evil. On the contrary, it frightened me because it was
so beautiful, because it was so good.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Syme, are you ill?
subQuotationList: ['Syme,', 'are you ill?']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText:
It was like the face of some ancient archangel, judging justly after
heroic wars. There was laughter in the eyes, and in the mouth honour
and sorrow. There was the same white hair, the same great, grey-clad
shoulders that I had seen from behind. But when I saw him from behind I
was certain he was an animal, and when I saw him in front I knew he was
a god.
subQuotationList:
['It was like the face of some ancient archangel, judging justly after
heroic wars. There was laughter in the eyes, and in the mouth honour
and sorrow. There was the same white hair, the same great, grey-clad
shoulders that I had seen from behind. But when I saw him from behind I
was certain he was an animal, and when I saw him in front I knew he was
a god.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Pan, was a god and an animal.
subQuotationList: ['Pan,', 'was a god and an animal.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Then, and again and always, that has been for me the mystery of Sunday, and it is also
the mystery of the world. When I see the horrible back, I am sure the
noble face is but a mask. When I see the face but for an instant, I
know the back is only a jest. Bad is so bad, that we cannot but think
good an accident; good is so good, that we feel certain that evil could
be explained. But the whole came to a kind of crest yesterday when I
raced Sunday for the cab, and was just behind him all the way.
subQuotationList:
['Then, and again and always,', 'that has been for me the mystery of Sunday, and it is also
the mystery of the world. When I see the horrible back, I am sure the
noble face is but a mask. When I see the face but for an instant, I
know the back is only a jest. Bad is so bad, that we cannot but think
good an accident; good is so good, that we feel certain that evil could
be explained. But the whole came to a kind of crest yesterday when I
raced Sunday for the cab, and was just behind him all the way.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Had you time for thinking then?
subQuotationList: ['Had you time for thinking then?']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
Time, for one outrageous thought. I was suddenly
possessed with the idea that the blind, blank back of his head really
was his face an awful, eyeless face staring at me! And I fancied that
the figure running in front of me was really a figure running
backwards, and dancing as he ran.
subQuotationList:
['Time,', 'for one outrageous thought. I was suddenly
possessed with the idea that the blind, blank back of his head really
was his face an awful, eyeless face staring at me! And I fancied that
the figure running in front of me was really a figure running
backwards, and dancing as he ran.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Horrible!
subQuotationList: ['Horrible!']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
Horrible is not the word, It was exactly the worst
instant of my life. And yet ten minutes afterwards, when he put his
head out of the cab and made a grimace like a gargoyle, I knew that he
was only like a father playing hide-and-seek with his children.
subQuotationList:
['Horrible is not the word,', 'It was exactly the worst
instant of my life. And yet ten minutes afterwards, when he put his
head out of the cab and made a grimace like a gargoyle, I knew that he
was only like a father playing hide-and-seek with his children.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: It is a long game,
subQuotationList: ['It is a long game,']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText:
Listen to me, Shall I tell
you the secret of the whole world? It is that we have only known the
back of the world. We see everything from behind, and it looks brutal.
That is not a tree, but the back of a tree. That is not a cloud, but
the back of a cloud. Cannot you see that everything is stooping and
hiding a face? If we could only get round in front
subQuotationList:
['Listen to me,', 'Shall I tell
you the secret of the whole world? It is that we have only known the
back of the world. We see everything from behind, and it looks brutal.
That is not a tree, but the back of a tree. That is not a cloud, but
the back of a cloud. Cannot you see that everything is stooping and
hiding a face? If we could only get round in front']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Look! the balloon is coming down!
subQuotationList: ['Look!', 'the balloon is coming down!']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
He is dead! And now I know he was my friend my friend in
the dark!
subQuotationList: ['He is dead!', 'And now I know he was my friend my friend in\nthe dark!']
speaker: Gogol
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
Dead! You will not find him dead easily. If
he has been tipped out of the car, we shall find him rolling as a colt
rolls in a field, kicking his legs for fun.
subQuotationList: ['Dead!', 'You will not find him dead easily. If\nhe has been tipped out of the car, we shall find him rolling as a colt\nrolls in a field, kicking his legs for fun.']
speaker: The Secretary
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Gogol'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Clashing his hoofs, The colts do, and so did
Pan.
subQuotationList: ['Clashing his hoofs,', 'The colts do, and so did\nPan.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Pan again! You seem to think Pan is
everything.
subQuotationList: ['Pan again!', 'You seem to think Pan is\neverything.']
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText: So he is, in Greek. He means everything.
subQuotationList: ['So he is,', 'in Greek. He means everything.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText:
Don't forget, that he also means
Panic.
subQuotationList: ["Don't forget,", 'that he also means\nPanic.']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText: It fell over there, Let us follow it!
subQuotationList: ['It fell over there,', 'Let us follow it!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Oh, if he has cheated us all by getting killed! It would be like one
of his larks.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, if he has cheated us all by getting killed! It would be like one\nof his larks.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
Gentlemen, my master has a carriage waiting for you in the
road just by.
subQuotationList: ['Gentlemen,', 'my master has a carriage waiting for you in the\nroad just by.']
speaker: A Tall Man
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']], [['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText: Who is your master?
subQuotationList: ['Who is your master?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'A Tall Man']

quoteText: I was told you knew his name,
subQuotationList: ['I was told you knew his name,']
speaker: A Tall Man
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText: Where is this carriage?
subQuotationList: ['Where is this carriage?']
speaker: The Secretary

quoteText:
It has been waiting only a few moments, My master
has only just come home.
subQuotationList: ['It has been waiting only a few moments,', 'My master\nhas only just come home.']
speaker: A Tall Man
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: Show us the place,
subQuotationList: ['Show us the place,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'A Tall Man']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
What can it all mean? Is this
another joke of Sunday's?
subQuotationList: ['What can it all mean?', "Is this\nanother joke of Sunday's?"]
speaker: Dr. Bull

quoteText:
I don't know, but if it is, it's one of the jokes you talk about. It's
a good-natured one.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know,", "but if it is, it's one of the jokes you talk about. It's\na good-natured one."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Refreshments are provided for you in your room.
subQuotationList: ['Refreshments are provided for you in your room.']
speaker: Another Man In The Same Uniform
referringExpression: This impressive person said to the bewildered Syme

quoteText: I have put out your clothes, sir.
subQuotationList: ['I have put out your clothes, sir.']
speaker: His Valet

quoteText: Clothes! I have no clothes except these,
subQuotationList: ['Clothes!', 'I have no clothes except these,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
My master asks me to say, that there is a fancy
dress ball tonight, and that he desires you to put on the costume that
I have laid out. Meanwhile, sir, there is a bottle of Burgundy and some
cold pheasant, which he hopes you will not refuse, as it is some hours
before supper.
subQuotationList:
['My master asks me to say,', 'that there is a fancy
dress ball tonight, and that he desires you to put on the costume that
I have laid out. Meanwhile, sir, there is a bottle of Burgundy and some
cold pheasant, which he hopes you will not refuse, as it is some hours
before supper.']
speaker: His Valet
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President']], [['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['The President'], ['Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
Cold pheasant is a good thing, and Burgundy
is a spanking good thing. But really I do not want either of them so
much as I want to know what the devil all this means, and what sort of
costume you have got laid out for me. Where is it?
subQuotationList:
['Cold pheasant is a good thing,', 'and Burgundy
is a spanking good thing. But really I do not want either of them so
much as I want to know what the devil all this means, and what sort of
costume you have got laid out for me. Where is it?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: You're to be dressed as Thursday, sir,
subQuotationList: ["You're to be dressed as Thursday, sir,"]
speaker: His Valet

quoteText:
Dressed as Thursday! It doesn't sound a
warm costume.
subQuotationList: ['Dressed as Thursday!', "It doesn't sound a\nwarm costume."]
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Oh, yes, sir, the Thursday costume is quite
warm, sir. It fastens up to the chin.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, yes, sir,', 'the Thursday costume is quite\nwarm, sir. It fastens up to the chin.']
speaker: His Valet

quoteText:
Well, I don't understand anything, I have been
used so long to uncomfortable adventures that comfortable adventures
knock me out. Still, I may be allowed to ask why I should be
particularly like Thursday in a green frock spotted all over with the
sun and moon. Those orbs, I think, shine on other days. I once saw the
moon on Tuesday, I remember.
subQuotationList:
["Well, I don't understand anything,", 'I have been
used so long to uncomfortable adventures that comfortable adventures
knock me out. Still, I may be allowed to ask why I should be
particularly like Thursday in a green frock spotted all over with the
sun and moon. Those orbs, I think, shine on other days. I once saw the
moon on Tuesday, I remember.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: Beg pardon, sir, Bible also provided for you,
subQuotationList: ['Beg pardon, sir,', 'Bible also provided for you,']
speaker: His Valet

quoteText:
This is getting wilder and wilder, Who are these people who provide cold pheasant and Burgundy,
and green clothes and Bibles? Do they provide everything?
subQuotationList: ['This is getting wilder and wilder,', 'Who are these people who provide cold pheasant and Burgundy,\nand green clothes and Bibles? Do they provide everything?']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText:
Yes, sir, everything, Shall I help you
on with your costume?
subQuotationList: ['Yes, sir, everything,', 'Shall I help you\non with your costume?']
speaker: His Valet

quoteText: Oh, hitch the bally thing on!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, hitch the bally thing on!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme

quoteText: We do not know yet that he is not dead in a field.
subQuotationList: ['We do not know yet that he is not dead in a field.']
speaker: The Secretary
referringExpression: Secretary looked across the empty throne at Syme and said
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
We will eat and drink later, Let us remain together a
little, we who have loved each other so sadly, and have fought so long.
I seem to remember only centuries of heroic war, in which you were
always heroes epic on epic, iliad on iliad, and you always brothers in
arms. Whether it was but recently (for time is nothing), or at the
beginning of the world, I sent you out to war. I sat in the darkness,
where there is not any created thing, and to you I was only a voice
commanding valour and an unnatural virtue. You heard the voice in the
dark, and you never heard it again. The sun in heaven denied it, the
earth and sky denied it, all human wisdom denied it. And when I met you
in the daylight I denied it myself.
subQuotationList:
['We will eat and drink later,', 'Let us remain together a
little, we who have loved each other so sadly, and have fought so long.
I seem to remember only centuries of heroic war, in which you were
always heroes epic on epic, iliad on iliad, and you always brothers in
arms. Whether it was but recently (for time is nothing), or at the
beginning of the world, I sent you out to war. I sat in the darkness,
where there is not any created thing, and to you I was only a voice
commanding valour and an unnatural virtue. You heard the voice in the
dark, and you never heard it again. The sun in heaven denied it, the
earth and sky denied it, all human wisdom denied it. And when I met you
in the daylight I denied it myself.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President']], [['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']]]

quoteText:
But you were men. You did not forget your secret honour, though the
whole cosmos turned an engine of torture to tear it out of you. I knew
how near you were to hell. I know how you, Thursday, crossed swords
with King Satan, and how you, Wednesday, named me in the hour without
hope.
subQuotationList:
['But you were men. You did not forget your secret honour, though the
whole cosmos turned an engine of torture to tear it out of you. I knew
how near you were to hell. I know how you, Thursday, crossed swords
with King Satan, and how you, Wednesday, named me in the hour without
hope.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Gabriel Syme'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe'], ['Inspector Ratcliffe']]]

quoteText: Who and what are you?
subQuotationList: ['Who and what are you?']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
referringExpression: the blackbrowed Secretary implacable turned in his chair towards Sunday and said

quoteText:
I am the Sabbath, I am the peace of
God.
subQuotationList: ['I am the Sabbath,', 'I am the peace of\nGod.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
I know what you mean, and it is exactly that that I cannot
forgive you. I know you are contentment, optimism, what do they call
the thing, an ultimate reconciliation. Well, I am not reconciled. If
you were the man in the dark room, why were you also Sunday, an offense
to the sunlight? If you were from the first our father and our friend,
why were you also our greatest enemy? We wept, we fled in terror; the
iron entered into our souls and you are the peace of God! Oh, I can
forgive God His anger, though it destroyed nations; but I cannot
forgive Him His peace.
subQuotationList:
['I know what you mean,', 'and it is exactly that that I cannot
forgive you. I know you are contentment, optimism, what do they call
the thing, an ultimate reconciliation. Well, I am not reconciled. If
you were the man in the dark room, why were you also Sunday, an offense
to the sunlight? If you were from the first our father and our friend,
why were you also our greatest enemy? We wept, we fled in terror; the
iron entered into our souls and you are the peace of God! Oh, I can
forgive God His anger, though it destroyed nations; but I cannot
forgive Him His peace.']
speaker: The Secretary
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The President']], [['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['The President'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['The President']]]

quoteText:
No, I do not feel fierce like that. I am grateful to you,
not only for wine and hospitality here, but for many a fine scamper and
free fight. But I should like to know. My soul and heart are as happy
and quiet here as this old garden, but my reason is still crying out. I
should like to know.
subQuotationList:
['No,', 'I do not feel fierce like that. I am grateful to you,
not only for wine and hospitality here, but for many a fine scamper and
free fight. But I should like to know. My soul and heart are as happy
and quiet here as this old garden, but my reason is still crying out. I
should like to know.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'The President']

quoteText:
It seems so _silly_ that you should have been on both sides and fought
yourself.
subQuotationList: ['It seems so _silly_ that you should have been on both sides and fought\nyourself.']
speaker: Inspector Ratcliffe
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText: I understand nothing, but I am happy. In fact, I am going to sleep.
subQuotationList: ['I understand nothing, but I am happy. In fact, I am going to sleep.']
speaker: Dr. Bull
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
I am not happy, because I do not understand. You let me stray a little too near to
hell.
subQuotationList: ['I am not happy,', 'because I do not understand. You let me stray a little too near to\nhell.']
speaker: Professor De Worms

quoteText: I wish I knew why I was hurt so much.
subQuotationList: ['I wish I knew why I was hurt so much.']
speaker: Gogol
addressees: ['The President', 'Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Dr. Bull', 'The Secretary', 'Gabriel Syme']

quoteText:
I have heard your complaints in order. And here, I think, comes
another to complain, and we will hear him also.
subQuotationList: ['I have heard your complaints in order. And here, I think, comes\nanother to complain, and we will hear him also.']
speaker: The President
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor De Worms', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'Gogol', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme'], ['Gregory'], ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President'], ['Mr. Lucian Gregory']]]

quoteText:
Gregory! Why, this is the
real anarchist!
subQuotationList: ['Gregory!', 'Why, this is the\nreal anarchist!']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Mr. Lucian Gregory', 'Dr. Bull', 'The President']

quoteText:
Yes, I am the
real anarchist. You are right, I am a destroyer.
I would destroy the world if I could.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,', 'I am the\nreal anarchist.', 'You are right,', 'I am a destroyer.\nI would destroy the world if I could.']
speaker: Mr. Lucian Gregory
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President']

quoteText:
Oh, most unhappy man, try to be happy! You have red hair
like your sister.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, most unhappy man,', 'try to be happy! You have red hair\nlike your sister.']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Mr. Lucian Gregory', 'Dr. Bull', 'The President']

quoteText:
My red hair, like red flames, shall burn up the world, I thought I hated everything more than common men can hate anything;
but I find that I do not hate everything so much as I hate you!
subQuotationList: ['My red hair, like red flames, shall burn up the world,', 'I thought I hated everything more than common men can hate anything;\nbut I find that I do not hate everything so much as I hate you!']
speaker: Mr. Lucian Gregory
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Dr. Bull', 'Gabriel Syme', 'The President']

quoteText: I never hated you,
subQuotationList: ['I never hated you,']
speaker: Gabriel Syme
addressees: ['Professor De Worms', 'Gogol', 'Inspector Ratcliffe', 'The Secretary', 'Mr. Lucian Gregory', 'Dr. Bull', 'The President']

quoteText:
You! You never hated because you never lived. I know what
you are all of you, from first to last you are the people in power! You
are the police the great fat, smiling men in blue and buttons! You are
the Law, and you have never been broken. But is there a free soul alive
that does not long to break you, only because you have never been
broken? We in revolt talk all kind of nonsense doubtless about this
crime or that crime of the Government. It is all folly! The only crime
of the Government is that it governs. The unpardonable sin of the
supreme power is that it is supreme. I do not curse you for being
cruel. I do not curse you (though I might) for being kind. I curse you
for being safe! You sit in your chairs of stone, and have never come
down from them. You are the seven angels of heaven, and you have had no
troubles. Oh, I could forgive you everything, you that rule all
mankind, if I could feel for once that you had suffered for one hour a
real agony such as I
subQuotationList:
['You!', 'You never hated because you never lived. I know what
you are all of you, from first to last you are the people in power! You
are the police the great fat, smiling men in blue and buttons! You are
the Law, and you have never been broken. But is there a free soul alive
that does not long to break you, only because you have never been
broken? We in revolt talk all kind of nonsense doubtless about this
crime or that crime of the Government. It is all folly! The only crime
of the Government is that it governs. The unpardonable sin of the
supreme power is that it is supreme. I do not curse you for being
cruel. I do not curse you (though I might) for being kind. I curse you
for being safe! You sit in your chairs of stone, and have never come
down from them. You are the seven angels of heaven, and you have had no

mankind, if I could feel for once that you had suffered for one hour a
real agony such as I']

quoteText:
I see everything, everything that there is. Why does each
thing on the earth war against each other thing? Why does each small
thing in the world have to fight against the world itself? Why does a
fly have to fight the whole universe? Why does a dandelion have to
fight the whole universe? For the same reason that I had to be alone in
the dreadful Council of the Days. So that each thing that obeys law may
have the glory and isolation of the anarchist. So that each man
fighting for order may be as brave and good a man as the dynamiter. So
that the real lie of Satan may be flung back in the face of this
blasphemer, so that by tears and torture we may earn the right to say
to this man, 'You lie!' No agonies can be too great to buy the right to
say to this accuser, 'We also have suffered.' It is not true that we have never been broken. We have been broken
upon the wheel. It is not true that we have never descended from these
thrones. We have descended into hell. We were complaining of
unforgettable miseries even at the very moment when this man entered
insolently to accuse us of happiness. I repel the slander; we have not
been happy. I can answer for every one of the great guards of Law whom
he has accused. At least Have you, have you ever suffered?
